1.content: So which girl will you choose?
1.title: IT BEGINS

11.content: So how will our Celestial Magi expand?
11.title: Lucy Heartphilia

111.content: WG With or w/o Vore?
111.title: Weight Gain/Vore

choices: She tries taking a jog to lose weight
111211.content:
After the Grand Magic Games had been won by Fairy Tail, every competing member of the guild got a part of the prize money. Because of this Lucy didn't need to go onto missions to get money for her rent, so for the last month she had been only feasting and lazing around, doing nothing but stuff her face. This showed clearly in her physique, her formerly slim, 103lbs body filling out, gaining 30lbs to her formerly thin body.

She stood in front of a mirror, prodding and probing certain areas of her body that had widened and softened. Her formerly flat belly had gained a soft layer of pudge to it and her breasts going up a cup size. But most of her gain was in her ass, it being nicely sized for a girl her age before, now having gained a serious ghetto booty. Her tighs had widened slightly to accommodate for her larger behind.

Lucy was always pretty slim, even though she had the best cooks when she was little and living at the Heartfilia mansion. The food in the guild wasn't exactly made for dieting either, but she had managed to keep her slim but curvy figure. So having gained weight was something new to her, never having any excess to her body before.
111211.title: The first signs.

choices: Convinced herself that she could lose the weight anytime
She is ignorant of her weight from now on
1112111.content:
Lucy decided that she would have to lose weight, as it would only slow her down on missions. She squeezed into a too small sports bra, a tank top that showed more cleavage than usual, workout pants which were quite tight around her behind and a pair of running shoes. She left her house and began a steady jog...

But not for long because after only a few hundred yards she was panting and wheezing, trying to regain her breath.

"Man, I really am tired, I should probably head back. " She thought out loud. When she got back, she was sweating and panting again.

After taking a shower, Lucy...
1112111.title: She tries taking a jog to lose weight

choices: Someone else comes to talk to her
11121111.content:
A few months later...

In the Fairy Tail guild hall one member of the guild was sitting at a table which was covered in a feast fit for at least 6 people, but only one person was eating it. This person was Lucy Heartfilia, a Celestial Mage and as of a few months ago local fat ass.

Because of Team Natsu being temporarily disbanded because Natsu wanted to train she didn't go on any missions, allowing the pounds to pile on. Erza went on a S Class mission and Gray, not wanting to be weaker than Natsu went training to. So she was left at the guild with nothing to do but stuff her face.

She had grown immensely over the last few months, her belly becoming a small gut and her breasts growing until they were the size of prized melons. Most of the weight was located below the waist though, as she sat down on two chairs because her ass was too big for one. Her tighs were now constantly connected, forcing her into a waddle and preventing her knees from touching each other. Her calf's were the size of a thin girls tighs and ended in pudgy little feet. She had gained a small double chin and pudgy cheeks, complimenting her soft figure. Lucy's arms had also swelled, burying any muscles she had in them in soft, jiggly tissue.

Her failed workout attempt months ago was the only effort she made to lose weight, and now after she had gotten so big she had to admit to herself that she kind of liked the feeling of her fat. Lucy had to admit to herself that the feeling she had when her entire body entered a jiggling motion was incredible and the constant rubbing of her tighs was quite *ahem* erotic.

So now she embraced every new pound, and was waiting on the next to be added to her expansive frame.
11121111.title: Convinced herself that she could lose the weigh...

111212.content:
Natsu, Happy and Lucy were all staring at the flier they had taken off the board.

"How many zeroes is that?" Natsu asked, dazed by the sheer size of the number.

"Enough to buy at least 3 lifetime's worth of fish!" Happy exclaimed.

"Wait a minute!" Lucy, the buxom blonde of Team Natsu snatched the flier as Natsu and Happy were marveling at it. "I got this flier, so I think I should have it! This would pay my rent for years, and for once, Id have money to spend for myself!"

"Hey, don't be greedy, Lucy!" the blue cat yelled, "We're a team, so we should all go on it."

"Can't you dunderheads read? Look!" The boys leaned in to read the description of the mission. 'Infiltrate a FEMALE ONLY party to find an undercover member of a female Dark Guild.'

"Ah, c'mon Lucy! We could just dress up! Happy makes a great girl!"

"Aye!"

"I could go with you!" The trio turned and saw...
111212.title: Too Many Zeroes to Count

11122.content: Alright then. Magical or Supernatural? Almost there....
11122.title: Magical/supernatural

choices: Ouch! She lands on the couch fortunately. But now she sprained her leg!
1112211.content:
If there was one thing Lucy Heartphilia loved it was books. She loved to read about stories and take notes to hone her craft in writing her own novel.

And the Fairy Tail Archives are loaded with books.

After winning the Magic Games against Sabertooth and thwarting the Eclipse Plan by the corrupt Council Knight Arcadias, Fairy Tail got their winning purse and bought back their old Guild hall, which was foreclosed on earlier due to debt. It took a while, but thanks to everyone's help, the Guild managed to bring the old Guild hall back to normal.

Lucy chuckled when Erza used the idea of competition for Gray and Natsu to help with cleaning, dusting, and arranging furniture. Those two can do great things when they put their minds to it...and when it's against each other.

"Those two will never change," she smiled. As she dragged the wheely ladder across the racks of books in the library, she began to climb the long wooden ladder at the “G” Section.

“I remember there was a new novel here called the ‘Great Galen’ around here somewhere,” pondered the blonde to herself. “It was released sometime while we were trapped at Tenroujima. Oh…” She pouted. “Don’t tell me Makarov didn’t buy the –“ Her train thought stopped. Why would Makarov buy a novel. The only literary item he would buy would be swimsuit magazines.

“I wouldn’t put it past the old geezer,” muttered Lucy to herself as she began to climb back down, past the ‘Gr’ to the ‘Gl’ and her leg accidentally slipped on the ladder peg.

“eep!” Her hand instinctively reached out to grab something, in this case a book, but it fell down with her. “Kyaaaah! H-H-Help!!”

Unknown to her, the book that she reached out was wrapped tightly inside her arms, as she was curled up in a fetal position as she fell. She did not notice the book glowing a mysterious light onto her midsection.
1112211.title: The Glutton Grimoire

choices: They decide to read the book.
They decide to read it later.
11122111.content:
In the midst of falling, Lucy had shut her eyes in fear. She felt herself practically cry out. But the expected impact never came. She'd expected it to be hard and painful, but it felt as if the floor had suddenly softened beneath her, letting her sink and slow down gently before she was lifted back up.

Hesitantly, the blonde Stellar Spirit Mage opened her eyes to see the ceiling above her. Still clutching the book under one arm against her stomach, she lifted herself up. At first, getting up felt a little unsteady. Using her spare hand however she pressed against whatever was beneath her and pushed herself up into a seated position. Beneath her, Lucy saw a group of letters. Actual letters, like you'd see in a book, that seemed so soft and comfy to touch, like a pillow. All of the letters, of course, were packed together to spell a word - "Soft".

"Phew... That was close..." a voice quietly sighed. Looking up, the blonde smiled a little at the sight of a blue-haired Mage. A wordsmith who'd read as many books in her lifetime as Lucy had, Lucy wasn't surprised that it had been Levy who'd saved her from hitting the floor. Most of the other girls weren't exactly interested in reading - not that it bored them, but this was Fairy Tail. Most, even the women, looked forward to drinking and fighting.

"Thanks, Levy. I was worried for a second there..." Lucy remarked as she stood up from the soft, bed-like "Word".

"Say, Lucy, what's that book under your arm?" Levy asked. Raising a brow, Lucy looked down and at last began to notice the book in her grasp. Feeling a little sheepish, she looked back to Levy with a small smile.

"Oh, I guess I must have accidentally taken this book down with me when I fell..." Lucy remarked, looking back down at the book. Inspecting the book's title, the blonde couldn't help but raise a brow. "The Glutton Grimoire? I don't think I've heard of this book before...".

"Hm?" Levy responded as she walked closer. Standing by Lucy's side, she looked down in unison with Lucy at the book. She certainly never remembered seeing that book before, and she was pretty sure she'd read at least most of the books in Fairy Tail's library. "I don't remember it. Think we should take a look?".
11122111.title: Someone saves her! But who?

choices: They head out on the town for brunch. Girls only!
They meet someone on the way. But who?
111221111.content:
“Yeah sure,” replied Lucy as she took a seat on a nearby table, Levy sitting down next to her.

“You think this might jog a memory?” Asked the blonde as the bluenette opened the book at a random spot. Within the book’s contents was a written red dialect.

“This ring a bell? I don’t think I’ve seen a language like that,” Pondered Lucy to herself. Levy squinted her eyes and moved the book clockwise and side to side.

“Not really. Lucy I think I’m looking at an alien language here or something,” said Levy as she placed her index finger on the red letters. Lucy followed her finger to the red letters.

“Wow, should we tell Master about this?”

“Maybe for lets-“ the two were interrupted as a red light shined from the letters.

“What in the-“ Then all of sudden the letters came out of the tome and as if all the letters and characters were taken from the book and began to hover in mid-air!

Before the girls could cry out in surprise, the letters then attached themselves to their hands and began to climb up their skin!

“Eeeeeh! What’s happening!” Cried out Lucy as she tried to shake off the letters from crawling on her person. She suddenly shivered as the letters, while she couldn’t feel them physically, were crawling up her arm and down past her breasts.

“I don’t know!” Yelled Levy in tandem as she tried to use a spell to dispel the increasing red letters, but they kept coming and attaching themselves to the girls. The letters began to glow brighter and both girls screamed.

And when the light faded both girls were waving their arms around and when Levy opened her eyes, she noticed the letters were gone from their bodies. She inspected her legs, inside her shirt and tapped the flailing Lucy’s shoulder.

“Lucy,” she said, and the blonde stopped her hysterical screaming and blinked. She blinked at the now letter-less Levy and then down at her own form.

“Hey…the letters are gone!” Said Lucy as she looked around her legs, her arms, and around her midriff. Levy looked a bit sour.

“This must have been a prank,” she said with puffed cheeks. “Should we tell the Master?”

“Knowing Master HE might have been the one behind it,” deadpanned Lucy.

“Good point.”

Suddenly both girls placed their hands on their growling stomachs, having just noticed their growls and pangs.

“I haven’t ate breakfast yet. You?” Asked the blonde.

“Not me,” replied the bluenette. “Wanna get some?”

“Sure! We can find our prankster later.”
111221111.title: They decide to read the book.

1112211112.content:
Deciding to sate their hunger before they searched for the prankster, the two young women stepped out from the library. Although normally they might have considered eating breakfast at the Guild, Natsu, Gajeel and Gray seemed to have already started a brawl of sorts. Eating breakfast in this kind of atmosphere would be too difficult, they noted as one of Gray's shoes zipped past their head and hit the wall behind them.

"Maybe we should eat out, in a Café or something," Lucy remarked, letting out a little sigh at the sight. Watching Natsu begin breathing fire encouraged Levy to nod in agreement.

"Yeah, let's," Levy agreed as the two began to slip out of the Guild Hall, dodging the thrown chairs and occasional heaps of Gray's clothing. In spite of the loud crashing and mayhem ongoing around them, the two young women managed to just escape before they could be caught up in the chaos. It almost came naturally with Fairy Tail - when you spent this long with a group of brawlers, you learned how to escape the chaos.

"Come on, I remember seeing a nice Café up the road the other day," Levy commented, smiling as she took the lead. With Lucy quickly following, the two strode down the street by themselves under the morning sun.

As they walked, Lucy began to hear her stomach growl again and frowned a little, rubbing it with her hand. It felt as if she hadn't eaten anything in her life. Didn't she have anything to eat last night before going to bed? Could she really get this hungry? Hearing another growl, but realizing it wasn't from her, Lucy looked over to Levy, who blushed crimson red.

"I guess both of us must be starving. I could swear I didn't feel this hungry earlier though..." Levy muttered, somewhat surprised by her own hunger.

"Both of our stomachs sound like dragons..." Lucy joked lightly. What she didn't predict was that someone else would overhear her comment.

"What's this about dragons?"

The two girls suddenly turned around, nearly dying of shock as they saw a tall and strong figure practically looming over them. A heavy coat was draped over his shoulders, his blond hair spiked up a bit, but what made him most recognizable was the lightning-bolt-shaped scar running through one eye. This person, of course, could be none other than the Master's son.

"L-Laxus! I didn't expect to see you here. I... I was just making a joke. Our stomachs have been growling since we're so hungry. We haven't had breakfast yet..." Lucy tried to explain coherently. Raising a brow, Laxus didn't seem to be particularly amused by the joke. But then, both had gotten the feeling long ago that Laxus wasn't the joke type.

"I see. So, I'm guessing there's a fight at the guild? Figures. It's always so damn loud..." Laxus remarked, looking off to one side for a moment. He didn't seem to be particularly interested in going to the guild while there was a fight on. Lucy began to wonder....

"Say, Laxus, do you want to come and have breakfast with us?" Lucy asked, much to the surprise of Levy. Laxus observed her with a raised brow, likewise thrown a little off by the question. But nevertheless, he had an answer.
1112211112.title: They meet someone on the way. But who?

choices: They across to the cafe, no problems.
Oh? Someone they know is in sight! Who could it be....
11122111121.content:
“Eh, why not. Sure,” shrugged Laxus with his hands in his pockets. “Got a place in mind?”

“Well me and Levy were going to have breakfast at the Groove Café, and thanks for joining us!” Smiled Lucy.

“Don’t mention it,” said the male blonde as he followed Lucy and Levy down the street hands in pockets. Levy tapped Lucy on the shoulder.

“Lucy, why did you ask him out for breakfast?” whispered Levy in her ear.

“Hm?”

“I mean, it’s just so sudden and-“

“He’s staring you know,” pointed out the female blonde and Levy turned her head and saw Laxus staring at the two as he followed them. Levy decided to back off and in the back of her mind she’ll ask Lucy later.

“So…” Lucy slowed down to walk on Laxus’ left side. Levy is walking on Lucy’s right. “How have you been doing?” Asked Lucy awkwardly.

“Aside from finding my apartment taken by somebody else over the last seven years and trying to find a new place to crash as well as trying to find a job, peachy,” replied the Thunder Dragon Slayer mage, still keeping his trademark scowl.

“I know that feel,” said Lucy. “Well…not really since my Landlady held down my place while we were gone, and my dad in his will had enough money to cover the rent so…” She rubbed the back of head nervously while both Laxus and Levy rolled their eyes.

Then both girls held their stomachs with a disgruntled expression on their faces, the growling making Laxus quirk an eyebrow.

“So is this café close by or something?” He asked. “Judging by your stomachs, you girls must be famished.”

“No kidding…” Groaned Lucy.

“There it is!” Said Levy pointing down the road and across a bridge was the café.
11122111121.title: Laxus joins them.

choices: Satisfying their hunger for now, they head back to the Guild.
Even after finishing their breakfast, they're still hungry.
111221111211.content:
The three mages strolled down the street and across the bridge without pause. The way their stomachs were growling, Lucy and Levy could hardly even wait to start eating. As they entered the Café, they were immediately met with the fragrance of Oolong Tea. Lucy and Levy barely even noticed with their stomachs practically commanding them at this point, but it was more than powerful for Laxus and his Dragonslayer nose.

"At least it's not shi-" Laxus paused mid-sentence as he saw Lucy and Levy quickly rush to the nearest available table. He raised a brow. Hunger didn't even begin to describe it - these two must be desperate for food, given their eagerness. Nevertheless, he shrugged his shoulders and walked over, sitting himself down in a chair with Lucy and Levy to his left and right.

"Ah, good morning good sir! I suppose these girls must be, ahem, with you?" a waiter spoke, addressing Laxus directly as he stood by their table.

"W-With Laxus?" Lucy exclaimed, a little surprised by the waiter's comment. Laxus gave the man a stare only a delinquent could pull off. It seemed to have the desired effect, because the man's face began to sweat bullets as he shook his head.

"My apologies, young man. Never mind me, never mind... I suppose you three are looking to order? Perhaps you'd like our breakfast special? It consists of-".

"I'll take two!" Levy interrupted.

"Same!" Lucy chimed in as well. The waiter stared, a little caught off guard for a moment. However, he recovered himself and began to speak once more.

"I... Ah, didn't even tell you what it was...".

"I'm not too concerned. I mean, we're both very hungry... Anything would do, really..." Lucy answered for herself and Levy. Deciding it best not to question the two obviously eccentric girls, the waiter turned to Laxus, ready to ask if he had anything to order, only for Laxus to cut him off.

"Coffee will do. I already ate," he told him. Deciding it best not to speak again, the waiter quickly wrote the orders down and scurried off, ready to get their orders. In the meantime, Laxus looked back to the two girls.

"I didn't take either of you to be big eaters..." he remarked dryly, a little bit surprised. But he didn't seem to really push the topic further. Patiently, the three waited for their orders, making some brief small talk. Eventually the waiter came back, setting down their orders for them to begin eating while Laxus had his coffee.
111221111211.title: They across to the cafe, no problems.

choices: They decide to ask Laxus to see if they can come with him.
Lucy has a different idea, and they see an odd sign...
1112211112111.content:
"Man that hit the spot," smiled Lucy. "So good!"

"You can say that again girl!" Agreed Levy.

As Laxus dabbed his mouth with his napkin, he recollected the behavior of the younger girls in front of him. Basically, after the two breakfast specials, which consisted of a helping of hash browns, bacon, eggs, and buttered toast, the girls were all leaning back in their chairs, noticable rises in their midsections thanks to their stuffing of breakfast. Lucy's blue and white shirt rose a little, revealing a stuffed tummy. Levy's short orange dress made her a small bump around her abdomen as well. Both girls were relaxing back in their chairs patting their stomachs.

"We better be careful, we might lose our figures and turn out as bad as Droy!" Chuckled Lucy.

"Yeah, let's eat breakfast first thing we get up, that way we won't be as hungry like this again." Nodded the bluenette. She turned her head towards the taller blonde Thunder mage. "You've been really quiet Laxus. Got something on your mind?"

"Not really," remarked Laxus. "Just been thinking of where to find a place to set house and what not."

"Don't you live with Master?" Asked Lucy as she sipped her water. The blonde man shrugged.

"Not really. I can handle myself, although Gildarts was kind enough to let me crash at his place while he's away."

"Well that's good," said Levy. "Looking out for family is what Fairy Tail does best." Laxus nodded.

"Yeah..." Although the world passed by in seven years, for Laxus it was nearly six months. In October of X784 during the Fantasia Festival he was a power hungry maniac bent on reforming Fairy Tail by purging the weak so that only the strong can be it's members. After being defeated by Natsu and Gajeel he was exiled by Makarov and wandered around the various nations until he decided to stop for a trip to Tenroujima, right during a Guild war between his old guild and the strongest of the Balam Alliance, Grimoire Heart. He even helped his old guild defeat them and stood by them when Acnologia supposedly destroyed the island, until Mavis' spirit saved the guild with Fairy Sphere.

And before the Fantasia Festival he almost hurt Levy were it not for Gajeel taking the hit. And now, nearly half a year later for them they are just sitting down having coffee at a cafe.

"Laxus?" The mentioned blonde turned his head, his train of thought coming to an end at Lucy's voice. Now she was a newbie he once thought as merely a trophy girlfriend material.

He kicked himself mentally that he didn't come to his guild's aide during the Phantom Lord incident because he was arrogant enough to demand Lucy as his woman in exchange for his assistance.

"Yeah?"

"You're just really quiet for some reason, is something wrong?"

"I'm fine. Just...thinking on things," Laxus went for his wallet to pay the bill for the girl's breakfast.

"Eh? Laxus you don't need to do that, I mean, we can pay ourselves!" Protested Levy, touched by the tall blonde's offer.

"You girls have to worry about apartment rent and dorm payments. Gildarts lives in a paid off plaid. Besides I'm heading off on a job today so I can recover," said Laxus.

"Laxus how sweet," said Lucy with a smile. Laxus merely shrugged as he stood up. The girls stood up, but slowly, hands on their stuffed tummies.

"Phew, man I never felt so hungry in my life."

"Yeah same here."

The waiter waved his arm from behind the counter. "Thank you! Come again." Levy and Lucy gave their thanks as Laxus gave a grunt and a nod as he escorted the girls out. The two girls were whispering in each other's ears.

"Hey Lucy, we gotta pay back Laxus," whispered Levy.

"But how?" She replied back.

Laxus remained quiet but had a quirked eyebrow as the girls talked in front of him.

"Well...we could go with him on that job. Like give him a hand or something," commented the Script mage.

"Eh? You sure? We might get in the way, I mean he's the second strongest mage in the guild."

"Got any other suggestions?" And Lucy thought...
1112211112111.title: Satisfying their hunger for now, they head back...

11122111121112.content:
"What's this?" Lucy spoke, her gaze caught by a sign upon the wall. Raising a brow, Levy turned to stare at the page that had caught Lucy's eye. A poster upon the wall, advertising an eating competition. Both took a moment to stare and read, neither of them saying anything to one another. But in spite of themselves, both couldn't help but lick their lips. Even though they wouldn't call themselves gluttonous, something about the prospect of an eating contest enticed them.

"An eating contest... 8 o'clock tonight..." Lucy began, her fingers gently stroking her soft middle. This wasn't the kind of thing she would have normally considered - after all, she had a figure to watch! But something in her gut encouraged her to take part. No pun intended.

"The winner gets 1,000,000 Jewels too..." Levy added, biting her lower lip. The money sounded interesting, but really, the promise of food seemed to catch her attention more than whatever the reward was. Noticing at last how long both had been staring, the two looked to one another and paused, as if waiting for the other to speak first.

"Well... Just once couldn't hurt. And it would be nice to win that prize..." Lucy spoke.

"Yeah," Levy agreed. "I don't think pigging out once in a while is that bad".

With their decision made, the two made sure to memorize the details of the poster before proceeding to walk off together, ready to continue the day.
11122111121112.title: Lucy has a different idea, and they see an odd ...

choices: Still in chaos. What a surprise
The Guild was in clean up mode.
111221111211121.content:
Laxus quirked his eyes as he saw the girls whisper to each other in front of him. "Pardon me for asking, but what are you two talking about?" He heard 'jewels' and 'that bad' but his curiosity was still in need of satiating. The girls turned towards the tall blonde and looked sheepish.

"Uh well...we were thinking of a way to pay you back is all, for the breakfast that is," said Lucy.

"Yeah. We have to make it up to you somehow Laxus," nodded Levy with a grin.

"You don't need to, it's fine," said the Thunder mage.

"Well later one tonight we are still gonna find a way to pay you back, it's what friends do," Lucy spit her tongue out in a cute way and Laxus shrugged and rolled his eyes.

"Whatever, do what you want. I'm off to get that job done," He then turned left to go over a bridge. He waved his hand at the two girls. "Later."

"See ya tonight!" Waved Levy.

"Have a good trip!" Added the Celestial Mage. Laxus simple waved as he walked away. The bluenette and the blonde turned towards each other.

"Wanna head back to the guild? Maybe the ruckus is over," commented Levy.

"Sure let's go," answered Lucy as the two stuffed friends walked back to the Guild and found it...
111221111211121.title: They return to the Guild.

1112211112111211.content:
Watching chairs and tables get thrown across the room, with people smashing each other into walls and kicking them aside, Lucy and Levy couldn't really say they were surprised. Whether it was watching Natsu slam Gajeel through a table, seeing a mostly-naked Gray fend off Juvia whilst simultaneously beating up Jet and Droy or even just watching Master Makarov weeping about the council, none of it was particularly new to either of them. It had been wishful thinking expecting any of it to change by the time they got back.

"Knowing the guys, this will last until nightfall," Lucy sighed, exasperated as she folded her arms in front of herself. Levy nodded in agreement, watching the chaos unfolding before them. But then, the chaos seemed almost like clockwork. In that sense it was almost a kind of orderly chaos. Almost. Breaking from their thoughts however the girls suddenly saw a wooden table fly through the air towards them. Letting out shrill screams, the two girls quickly dove to the ground as the table passed over them, crashing out the door of the guild. Lying flat on their stomachs, they both sighed in relief.

"Maybe we should go back to the library and figure out what went on with that book. It would keep us away from all of this, at least..." Lucy suggested, biting her lower lip as she observed the in-fighting going on in the guild.

"Maybe we should," Levy agreed, nodding. "I really want to know what was going on with that book. It seemed really odd for a prank...". As both began to get up, pushing themselves back onto their feet, they both suddenly heard another voice speaking out behind them.

"What's this about a book?" the feminine voice asked. All of a sudden, both Lucy and Levy turned on their heels to see...
1112211112111211.title: Still in chaos. What a surprise

choices: The red letters begun appearing on her person! It's the book!
11122111121112111.content:
"Oh hey Mirajane," greeted the blonde to the silver haired waitress. The Take Over mage simply ignored the chaos erupting all around her and walked with the girls as they avoided the bedlam of Natsu and Gajeel beating each other senseless. "So we found an odd book this morning and we think it may have been a prank."

"Yeah," added Levy. "all these red letters came out of nowhere. Freak me out at first but nothing happened."

"Really?" Replied Mirajane. "I don't recall anyone trying to pull a prank in the archives. Do you have the book in question?"

"I think we left it by the table," said Levy as the trio rounded a corner and began walking down the stairs and into the library. As they walked down another flight of stairs Lucy covered her mouth to contain a burp, thankfully contained.

"Excuse me," said the blonde sheepishly. Mirajane curled her eyes up and chuckled. "Had a big breakfast."

"I see. Nothing wrong with enjoying a good meal," smiled Mirajane as the trio reached the main floor and started inspecting the tables and couches for the tome.

"What was the color of the book Levy?" Asked Lucy as she searched on a table nearest to the stairs.

"I don't remember, I remember the title was 'Glutton Grimoire' or something," responded the bluenette as she inspected the couches. Mirajane was also checking up on the tables at a leisurely calm pace until her hand touched a tome and then....
11122111121112111.title: Mirajane.

111221111211121111.content:
As Mirajane's hand traced the spine of one of the magical tomes, all of a sudden the book began to light up. Mirajane nearly fell backwards as the book shot out from the shelves right past her face, floating into the air. Mirajane paused, almost frozen as the book hung there in the air by itself. Before any of them could actually respond the book opened up and red letters began to shoot out. Mirajane let out a yelp as the red letters pressed against her body, covering up her bare skin and forming words in a foreign tongue none had ever heard of.

"What's going on? Is this some kind of joke?" Mirajane spoke in confusion, caught off guard by the tome. Lucy and Levy both stared at her for a moment, looking at the words printed on her body before they both began to speak.

"This is it - this is what happened earlier!" Lucy began, panicking. She wasn't sure what was going to happen next.

"Quick, maybe if we can shut the book before the spell activates-" Levy began, taking out a pen from her back pocket. Not even bothering to finish her sentence she began to write in the air. But it was too late. In a blinding flash, the letters covering Mirajane's form lit up the whole room. The next moment, the light began to fizzle out and the three girls rubbed their eyes, attempting to re-adjust to the light of the room.

"What happened?" Levy began, her eyes rapidly blinking as she tried to regain her senses. When they finally managed to form coherent shapes, she could see the book resting once again upon the table, shut closed. Stepping towards the book, Levy decided first to inspect it and figure out what just happened.

"A-Are you okay, Mirajane?" Lucy spoke, opening one eye slowly. For a moment everything was still a blur, but when her eyes readjusted she could see that Mirajane was standing there the same as normal. Mirajane herself began to look down at her body, seeing that it was no longer covered by the strange letters they had seen before. With a sigh, the white-haired barmaid smiled back at Lucy.

"It's okay, it seems I'm-" Mirajane stopped mid-sentence, all of a sudden feeling a new sensation flow throughout her body...
111221111211121111.title: The red letters begun appearing on her person! ...

choices: Levy yells out to them, telling them about the Grimoire's true contents...
Her stomach growls and decides a snack wouldn't hurt
1112211112111211111.content:
“Oh….” Groaned Mirajane as she put a hand on her stomach, which she felt groaning and growling at her. “My tummy…”

“Oh no did that book make you sick or something?” Asked Lucy in concern. Her visage darkened a little. “I knew it! It IS a prank!”

While Lucy was consoling a hungry barmaid, Levy was inspecting the tome, seeing all of it’s pages blank. She flipped back to the title, reading it’s title: Glutton Grimoire.

To be a glutton is to eat ravenously.

When she and Lucy opened the book the two of them pigged out on a huge breakfast.

She looked at her stomach, which was still a bit taut from the morning’s meal, and back at the book.

And she heard the penny drop.

“That’s it!” She exclaimed. She turned around to face Lucy-

But neither she nor Mirajane were present. She could hear the distinct fading sounds of the two girls up the stairs and in the hallway outside the archives.

“Ah cripe!” Cursed Levy as she ran up the stairs, and darted out to the hallway to follow the voice of the blonde and white haired woman.

She made it to the pantry of the guild, located in the basement and saw Mirajane and Lucy carrying out ingredients for…something…
1112211112111211111.title: She becomes incredibly hungry.

choices: They proceed to eat the cake.
Levy snaps to her senses and tries to warn them.
11122111121112111112.content:
"H-Hey, what are you doing with that? Wait, guys-!" Levy found herself stopping before she could call out to them again. All of a sudden her stomach felt incredibly empty as a loud growl emitted from her middle. Rubbing a hand over her soft belly, still plump from this morning's breakfast, her thoughts were mostly confusion. But in spite of her confusion at being hungry all over again despite it not having been very long, the pangs of hunger won her over and now she felt herself desiring food.

"Well, an early lunch isn't bad..." Levy remarked, her stomach growling yet again. As she stood there, both Mirajane and Lucy carried large bags and containers filled with all sorts of ingredients. At last they seemed to notice Levy standing at the stairs, both of them looking up with a smile on their faces.

"Levy-chan, Mirajane and I were feeling hungry, so we decided to have something to eat. Do you want to join us?" Lucy asked, raising a brow. Lucy couldn't deny her own confusion at being hungry again already, but her body was crying for food. She just wanted to stuff herself full.

"We've decided to make a large cake! Lucy suggested we should have chocolate. Do you think that sounds good?" Mirajane asked, smiling as she carried the bags of flour. Levy, unable to restrain herself, licked her lips excitedly.

"S-Sure, that sounds good... great! I'll go get some more ingredients!" Levy responded, quickly running into the pantry. In spite of her desire to tell them about the Grimoire, the hunger was overwhelming her common sense. Grabbing more than enough ingredients to fill her arms, Levy hastily ran back up the stairs to carry them up to the Guild's kitchen, where they were safe from the ongoing fighting at the Guild.

"Alright, let's get to work! I can have a big, delicious, mouth-watering..." Mirajane trailed off, practically watering at the mouth.

"M-Mirajane, please! You're just making me hungrier!" Lucy complained.

"Alright, sorry. I can have a big cake done in no time at all! I'll need your help though!" Mirajane told both Lucy and Levy, who were eager to get started. For the next hour they were grabbing all sorts of ingredients and throwing them together and mixing them, going through the steps of baking the cake until eventually at last a large chocolate cake stood upon the countertop before the three young women, who were all more than eager to devour it.
11122111121112111112.title: Her stomach growls and decides a snack wouldn...

choices: They frost their cakes, adding sugary goodness to their meal
F it. Eat the damn thing, and the frosting alone!
111221111211121111121.content:
“Should we add frosting to it?” Pondered Mirajane as she inspected the cake from top to bottom. It was a simple three layer cake, but it was a good two feet in diameter and two feet tall as well. It’s dark color showing it’s chocolate colors.

“Let’s add in strawberry frosting!” Chirped Lucy, finding a small jar of the pink condiment.

“Not really a fan of strawberry frosting, let’s do vanilla instead,” suggested Levy. She didn’t really wanted to follow through on this, but her stomach was craving the massive desert in front of her, regardless of her prior knowledge about the Grimoire.

“Why not we take a layer and plant our own frosting on it,” commented Lucy before Mirajane could retort. “That way we get our own equal share and our own frosting for it.” She quirked her head to the side and gave an infectious grin. “Everyone wins!” Levy caught it, as well as the silver haired woman.

“Girl I love the way you think,” smiled Levy. Mirajane nodded.

“Me too! I’ll get a spatula.” Mirajane wondered over to find the cooking tool required. “So how was your day,” she asked as she inspected the cooking tool shed(to think there’d be a small shed for cooking tools).

“Well we woke up, read, and went for breakfast with Laxus to avoid the chaos going on upstairs,” pointed out Lucy taking her finger and taking little bites of her strawberry frosting. Levy was doing the same with her vanilla frosting, relishing the taste.

“Oh~?” Cooed Mirajane in a teasing fashion. “You and Laxus went out on a date~?”

“Wha-n-no!” Stammered Lucy with a bit of pink on her face. “I said ‘We’ and I mean’t myself and Levy! And we just wanted to get breakfast together is all, I mean-“

“Of course of course,” nodded Mirajane with a smile on her visage. She started humming to herself.

“I can hear that!” Said Lucy and Levy both. Mirajane found a pizza-size spatula and began to separate the cake layers.

“Alright, let’s frost!”
111221111211121111121.title: They proceed to eat the cake.

choices: Levy snaps to her senses again and tells them about the book.
1112211112111211111211.content:
The three girls immediately set about their jobs, taking their own different layers of the cake and adding their own choices of icing. Each girl took to their task carefully, though all the while the three couldn't help but feel eager to simply devour the cake as it was. Their mouths watering, they hastily finished up their icing - Lucy with vanilla, Levy with strawberry and Mirajane with caramel. By the time the three girls were done, they all looked over their portions of cake with a lick of their lips. They wanted to sate their hunger now.

Each one practically dove into their cakes without a word of warning. Lucy quickly began to take handfuls of the cake and shove it into her mouth, gulping down as much as she possibly could with each mouthful. The taste was like ecstasy to her taste buds, the flavours on her tongue more vivid than she'd ever remembered anything tasting before. She didn't know why everything tasted so incredible, but she was far too intoxicated by it to really think about it. Whatever crumbs were left around her lips as she chewed down her food was quickly licked up by her tongue, making sure she didn't even leave a piece of the cake uneaten.

Levy was no different. Levy hungrily wolfed down the food in front of her, unable to contain herself. With a seemingly bottomless appetite she tore through the cake and devoured whole mouthfuls in moments. Whatever icing and crumbs were left on her fingers were quickly licked clean. Her eyes watched for even the tiniest crumbs, seeking to devour everything before her. The taste of everything sent a shiver down her spine. It was as though she had found the nectar and ambrosia of the gods themselves.

Mirajane was perhaps only slightly different to the other two. Though definitely absorbed by her growing hunger, every bite was followed by a moment of bliss as she savoured the incredible taste. Every mouth-watering crumb and intoxicating bite was not immediately swallowed down, but allowed a brief moment to be enjoyed as she found herself giving in to her gluttonous desires. But in a manner no different to Lucy or Levy, she left no crumb uneaten. To allow even a piece of such a delicious treat not be eaten was a crime against humanity to her.

As minutes passed, the three were slowly beginning to finish up their rather large portions of cake. Each of the three young women showed definite signs of their gluttony. Though Mirajane was left with merely a bloated belly, having been under the effects of the Glutton Grimoire for a shorter time, both Lucy and Levy sported swollen stomach distending into their laps, a layer of soft pudge coating their bodies. Their thighs and hips seemed thicker, but it was definite that both girls had gained substantial weight. What they could initially pass off as just a full stomach was now a sure sign of weight gain.
1112211112111211111211.title: They frost their cakes, adding sugary goodness ...

choices: The girls awake at night, their food digested and Levy tells them about the book
The girls awake to a visitor putting blankets on them...who is it?
11122111121112111112111.content:
"Oh my..." Groaned Mirajane as she leaned back into the chair, hand on her bulging cake filled food belly. "My goodness...I was quite hungry!" She chirped.

"Mmmm..." Moaned Lucy, her blue and white shirt rising thanks to her bulging belly, now the food from the breakfast starting to digest and now she had a bloated gut in the form of the frosting lathered cake. “So…full…”

Levy didn’t reply, only giving an unladylike belch from her lips. “Excuse me…” She murmured, her hand rubbing her bloated midsection. The bloated state left Levy unable to tell her friends about the Glutton Grimoire, and she laid down on her back, arms wide and her face with cake crumbs and cake frosting around her mouth. She smacked her lips a little.

“Oh…Why do I,” moaned Mirajane as she waddled towards the pantry, hand on her stomach as if she was pregnant. “feel so full yet…so hungry!” She moaned.

“Can’t eat…anymore…” Added Lucy. “So good…” She yawned, feeling the effects of a food coma clouding her senses.

Levy groaned as she sat up and used a nearby chair to support herself off the floor. “Lu-chan, we shouldn’t sleep here…” She groaned, not paying attention to Mirajane as the white haired girl was beginning to stuff her face with chips. She slowly walked forward and offered Lucy a hand, helping the Blonde up to her feet. They both yawned. “Let’s go…somewhere we can sleep…” Mirajane was munching hard on the chips, moaning at the fullness of her stomach and at her eating. She wanted to eat, but she was so full…
“Let’s go to the library…they have…” she yawned, giving off a belch in the process. “Some couches there…”

“good idea…Mirajane?” Said Levy as she looked over to the white haired girl who was pigging out on the chips bag. “We’re gonna take a nap in the library, just to-“ Another yawn. “Let ya know…”

The blunette heard a “mm-hmm” and trudged out of the giant kitchen to the hallway and she and Lucy walked slowly.

“Hey Levy-chan?”

“Yeah?”

“I remember that you said you wanted to say something but I was…” Lucy yawned and her eyes looked sleepy. “Talking with Mirajane…what was it?”

Levy opened her mouth, but her drowsiness along with her fullness prevented her from replying with the answer she wanted. “Maybe later…”

The two girls then walked slowly, groaning at the pain in their stuffed stomachs as they walked down the stairs, entering the library and eyeing the coaches. Lucy plopped down first, followed by Levy. The Script Mage used the Celestial Spirit Mage’s large breasts as a pillow.

“Lu-chan, your boobies are like pillows~,” cooed Levy as she yawned, cuddling her blonde friend.

“Levy-chan~,” moaned Lucy. “you tease…it tickles…” Both girls let out a giggle before the food coma finally caught up to them, sending them into sleep.

They were joined by a more stuffed Mirajane, her belly in pain and near bursting as she fell asleep on a lounge chair opposite of them, her dress risen thanks to the orb that was her giant food stuffed gut.
11122111121112111112111.title: They decide to eat more.

choices: Lucy realizes the Eating Contest must be starting soon.
Lucy realizes she never learned what the Glutton Grimoire was.
111221111211121111121112.content:
The three girls slept heavily, drifting off into their dreams. Whether it was because of the huge meal they'd just finished or the lingering influence of the Glutton Grimoire, they each dreamt of an endless land of sweets and desserts. They dreamt of lakes of caramel and toffee clouds. They dreamt of palaces of gingerbread and forests of taffy. They dreamt of blizzards of ice cream and seas of liquid chocolate. Intoxicating, euphoric gluttony consumed their thoughts as they all dreamt of wondrous deserts that, alas, could only exist in fantasy.

Lucy sighed in her sleep, shifting a little for comfort beneath Levy's form. Her chest rose and fell like wandering clouds, with Levy's face resting upon her breasts as though they were pillows. Lucy's arms draped around the blue-haired girl, embracing and holding onto her like a child would clutch a teddy bear going to bed. Hours passed as they slumbered.

But all of a sudden, Lucy's body felt warmer. Something soft slipped over her and Levy's figures. Wearily an eye began to flutter open, though the effort of doing so was akin to Atlas' lifting the world on his shoulders. A vague blur hovered above, pulling a sheet over her figure. Her eyes shut for a moment, but then her eyes began to pull open - not yet wide awake, but catching a glimpse of the figure as her mind deciphered the colours and shapes before her.

"Lax... us?" her voice whispered, barely making a sound. But the blond figure hovering over her heard and paused, looking down into her eyes. He seemed to mumble something, but Lucy didn't quite catch it.

"I didn't mean to wake you..." Laxus spoke, his stronger voice making a presence even as he tried to whisper. But the other girls had also begun to awake. Mirajane, lying across the couch opposite, began to move her arms to wipe away the tiredness from her eyes.

"Oh...? What are..." Mirajane paused, letting out a tired yawn as she brought her hands down from her eyes. "What are you doing here...?".

"Laxus is here...?" Levy muttered, still not quite in her head. But a few moments passed as realization dawned on her. She realized just how... Intimate her cuddling with Lucy looked. Letting out a surprised yelp Levy lifted herself up, now kneeling on the couch with one leg on either side of Lucy's frame. Her cheeks turned red, but she took a moment to notice the blankets draped over them all.

"Look, look, I just noticed you three snoring in here and I thought I'd give you each a blanket... I mean, a couch isn't much of a bed, is it?" Laxus defended himself, letting out an irritated sigh. But the irritation was faked - the three girls could tell. He was a nicer person than he let on. Looking up towards him, Lucy smiled a little.

"Thanks, Laxus... Oh, wait!"
111221111211121111121112.title: The girls awake to a visitor putting blankets o...

choices: Lucy and Levy head to Lucy's apartment to change, talking about things
After changing, the girls arrive at the contest ready to win!
1112211112111211111211121.content:
Laxus turned his head. “Whats up?” Lucy put her hands behind her back and looked a bit shy.

“Well…I was wondering if…umm…” Laxus quirked an eye.

“Wondering what? Speak your mind,” said the taller blond.

“I think what Lu-chan is trying to say here Laxus,” spoke Levy as she joined her friend. “Is that if you can watch me and Lu-chan win the eating contest!” Lucy did a double take at her blue haired friend with embarrassment and shock.

“Oh yeah that’s right! It’s tonight and we have about…” She looked down at her watch. “Three hours left. Enough time to clean up and put on something nice for the contest.” She looked back up at the wide eyed man. “So…do you want to watch us, give us support and what not?”

“Wouldn’t you ask Natsu, Gray, and Erza for that though?” Asked Mirajane as she walked forward. Laxus’ eyes darted and saw her stuffed middle but only for a moment.

“Erza’s out on a job already, and Natsu and Gray are cleaning up the Guild hall with Gajeel. Master’s orders after turning it into a wreck.” Lucy rolled her eyes.

“Not surprised. That’s so them.”

“Totally.” Agreed the blond. “And sure.” The blonde girl and the bluenette blinked.

“Eh? You will?” They asked. Laxus shrugged.

“Why not? I got nothing better to do.” The girls seemed to beam.

“Thanks Laxus!” they both said at the same time, bowing. Laxus simply nodded. As the girls ran past him and back up the stairs. They gave him one last look, smiling. And Laxus, although it was smile, smiled back. The duo left giggling all the while. Mirajane came up to his side.

“They like you Laxus~,” she cooed. Laxus looked down, then looked away, keeping his tough guy face while having a tinge of pink on his cheeks.

“I see…I also noticed they have gotten…softer…”

“Is that your way of saying they're getting fat?” She joked.

“I got no problem with it.” He was about to leave until Mirajane stopped him, placing a hand on his shoulder.

“What now Mira-“ He was stopped with lips meeting his own. Mirajane was kissing him! Laxus took a step back bewildered while Mirajane chuckled and closed eyes as she grinned.

“What was that for!” He gaped in surprise. He didn’t particularly mind it, just that it was so out of the blue it caught the second generation Dragon Slayer mage off guard.

“You’ve always been cute when you’re flustered Laxus, besides,” She walked away, giving him a wink. “I don’t have a problem becoming ‘soft’ for you, nor for those girls either~”

“What’s that supposed to mean?” Laxus blushed a little. The silver haired girl giggled to herself.

“What do you think?”

With that said, she skipped away humming to herself, leaving Laxus all alone in the library.

‘So I have three girls that likes me, possibly two of them bi, and one of them knows I’m into heavier chicks,’ He blinked. Then he gave a small grin.

‘Well, better cash in my check and get ready to support the girls. Maybe Mirajane can come along too?’
1112211112111211111211121.title: Lucy realizes the Eating Contest must be starti...

11122111121112111112111212.content:
The moon hung above in the evening sky as people gathered to watch the eating competition that would commence soon. Long tables had already been prepared, but the chefs were all busy in the kitchens getting ready to prepare the incredible feast that would begin soon. A table for sign-ups had already been set up by the entrance and plenty of people both fat and thin were signing up.

Observing it all, of course, were two young girls determined to win the contest. The two of them had both changed into new clothes that gave their figures a little more freedom - Lucy's outfit consisted of a blue and white tank top that held in her shapely breasts whilst exposing her soft, round belly that dipped over the edge of her blue mini-skirt. Her skirt just barely covered her bottom as her hips and backside had become a bit more prominent following her earlier eating sessions. A pair of white stockings stretched up her long yet chubby legs, ending just short enough to expose some skin between the stockings and her skirt. Lastly she wore a pair of blue shoes, along with a blue ribbon in her hair.

Levy, meanwhile, had tied back her blue hair in a ponytail with her bangs pulled into two additional side-tails that framed her face. Her outfit consisted of an orange tank top with separate orange sleeves bound to her upper arms that covered the length of her arms. Her doughy middle distended and hung down in front of her, hanging over her orange short-shorts. Her legs were left bare otherwise, with orange shoes covering her feet. Levy silently stared at her own middle, poking it gently with a finger. She could have sworn she was going to mention something earlier, but now it seemed as if the only thing she could think of was her own desire to eat. Part of her just wanted to begin the contest already, just so she could stuff herself silly.

"We've already signed up, now we just have to wait for Laxus..." Lucy commented, her cheeks blushing red a little as she thought of the blond. He really wasn't as bad a guy as he seemed - in spite of his abrasive nature, he was truly kind. There was a time when she couldn't understand how he and the Master were related, but now it made too much sense not to be true.

Levy looked over to Lucy as she was lost in thought, catching a glimpse of the round and soft stomach she now sported. Levy couldn't deny that there was a part of her that had always been attracted to Lucy. Lucy possessed a quality in her that Levy couldn't quite put into words, but it made her overwhelmingly glad that she'd gotten the chance to meet Lucy. The blonde was simply beautiful, yet ever since they had begun to gain weight Levy found herself catching glances of Lucy's curvier form. But before Lucy noticed Levy would always turn back to Lucy's face, if only to admire how round and chubby her features had gotten.

"I'm sure they'll be here shortly. Look!" Levy spoke, pointing down the street. The two girls stared down and smiled before giving waves to the two figures that were walking towards them.

The first, of course, was the tall and muscular Laxus, who instead of looking irritated or stone-faced actually possessed a small smile on his face. Beside him walked the white-haired beauty of Fairy Tail, Mirajane, who now wore a red bikini top that left her belly completely exposed. Though not as prominent as Lucy or Levy's, it was certainly nothing less than pudgy. Covering the woman's lower body was a red sarong that flowed around her, possessing a single slit down the side of her left leg that allowed her to occasionally show some skin as she walked.

"Hey," Laxus addressed them, waving back to the two girls. "It's going to start soon, isn't it?".

"Yeah!" Lucy replied, smiling as she looked up to the taller blond man. "You're just in time".

"I didn't expect to see you here, Mirajane," Levy remarked to the white-haired woman with mild surprise. Mirajane smiled back.

"Laxus asked if I wanted to come as well, so I thought I should. I wanted to see you two do your best!" Mirajane remarked. But even as she said that, she could sniff the scent of food that lingered in the air. All of a sudden it felt as if her stomach was begging her to find whatever it was and devour it. She kept a straight face, but now a sudden hunger had taken over her. Her mouth was already watering. She wanted to eat.

"Actually, I just had a thought! Mirajane, do you wanna join the contest too?" Lucy asked, raising a brow. Mirajane looked to the blonde and for a second she pondered the question. With her hunger now making itself known again, would she try joining up if only to sate it?
11122111121112111112111212.title: After changing, the girls arrive at the contest...

choices: We follow Lucy and Levy as they begin their run for the cash!
Why not see it from Laxus and Mirajane's perspective?
111221111211121111121112122.content:
The Guild waitress smiled and shook her head. “Thanks but no thanks. I appreciate the offer though!”

Laxus added in. “Yeah, and besides it’s duos, not trios unfortunately.”

“Oh yeah, duh,” Lucy bonked her head playfully. “My fault there, I forgot.” The white haired woman waved her hand.

“It’s fine. You two get ready, as for me.” She stretched her arms out. “I’m going to get something from concessions. You want some booze Laxus?” She turned towards the much taller man.

“Just some beer I guess, I’ll pay ya back afterwards if that’s fine,” shrugged the tall blonde. Mirajane nodded. “Good luck you two!” With that Mirajane trotted off to find the find the snack shack. The lightning mage and the celestial spirit mage stood along with the script mage.

“Well, you two get ready. I’m gonna find some spots to sit.” Lucy nodded at Laxus’ suggestion.

“He’s right Lu-chan. We gotta take our seats at the table.”

“You got it Laxus,” The man turned around. “Oh! One more thing!”

“Eh?” He turned his head. Lucy blushed a little and turned her eyes away.

“Thanks for coming…It um…” She absently scratched her girth a little. “Means a lot.”

“Yeah, me too.” Levy broke out into a huge grin. “You’re a lot more agreeable than Gajeel that’s for sure!”

Laxus grinned, although deep in his heart he felt a pang of guilt at what she said. After all, he did try to hurt her back seven years ago when he was in his “power-over-all” stage.

“Anytime.” His small grin and nod was all that was needed and he worked his way through the crowd to find Mirajane.

“Well, we better get our seats Lu-chan.” The blonde girl nodded.

“You got it Levy.”

The two found themselves signing up, then wearing unique tags on their shirts, and making their way to a nearby long table. Up above the table was a huge sign with three sections:

Course 1: Fruits and Appetizers.

Course 2: Main Course

Final Course: Dessert.

“So three stages huh? Not a problem,” said Lucy with a grin.

“You sure? I mean, we did eat a lot today. Maybe we should have-“

“What starve ourselves and waste away? Pfft yeah right!” Scoffed Lucy. “I got curves to worry about after all to up my sex appeal~.” She made a pose putting her hand behind her head.

Levy rolled her eyes and grumbled. Lucy turned towards her slightly shorter friend. “But hey Levy-chan, you’re not all bad yourself. You got a nice butt forming~.”

Now THAT made the bluenette blush. “S-Shut up I-“ She couldn’t find the words. She liked what Lucy was saying to her, but out in public where people could listen.

“Oh hey it’s starting!” The blond whispered into her friend’s ear, gaining her attention at the announcer walking in.

“Welcome! Today is the beginning of the 1st Annual Moon Festival, and to kick start the week of family fun, we are proud to host the main event of the first day: The Tri-Cycle Eating Contest!”

“Wouldn’t there be a tricycle then?” Whispered Levy into Lucy’s ear. Lucy shrugged and her eyes scanned the crowd for Laxus and Mirajane. No sign of them yet.

“As you see above you, we have three courses! A fruit and appetizer, a main course meal, and a desert! And you have to complete this cycle three times!” Lucy and Levy gave an “oh” in understanding.

“So three times the fun huh,” remarked the blonde. “Bring it on!”

“We are also having a timed system going. If you can complete a course, you can wait until we hand you the next course and so forth. After going through the three courses three times, whoever is finished the three courses fastest or is the last one standing is the winner. Should there be a tie, then we move onto the Sudden Death Round, and those details will remain unknown.”

Levy took it all in. "So we could just go slow and take our time as the other's stuff themselves silly, or we can bull rush through and get small breaks inbetween, along with getting the fastest time as well..."

“Oh!” Lucy pointed and waved towards the crowd, Levy falling her hand and seeing the tall Laxus giving a simple nod of his head in acknowledgement over the crowd.

And a hand holding a drumstick waving back. ‘Must be Mirajane,’ thought the Script Mage.

“Now without any delay,” the chefs brought out the plates. The first appetizer being a plate of about fourteen mozzarella sticks with marina sauce to the side, and another plate filled with eight. There was also pitchers and glasses of water nearby to help the contestants satisfy their thirst. A timer made of magical numbers appeared in the clearing.

“You may begin!”
111221111211121111121112122.title: Mirajane doesn't join the contest.

choices: Lucy and Levy continue onto the second cycle!
The perspective shifts to Mirajane and Laxus.
1112211112111211111211121221.content:
Lucy and Levy decided it best not to wait the moment they were told to start. But even if they wanted to pace themselves, it seemed as if their stomachs were begging them to hurry and devour everything before them. An intense hunger took control of their bodies and now the two women may as well have been puppets dancing to the tune of their stomachs.

Both girls certainly didn't spare themselves. Lucy and Levy both would take their mozzarella sticks and cover them in marina sauce before devouring them in quick bites. One bite was never enough - one mouthful wasn't enough. Nor two, nor three, nor ten. The two girls didn't waste even a crumb.

Occasionally, one of the two would fill their glasses to full and gulp down the entire glass of water in a matter of seconds before continuing again. Time wasn't the most important factor here - stamina was. As much as they desired to devour everything as quickly as possible, they also recognized that going through the cycle three times was going to take a toll on the capacity of their stomachs.

Lucy licked her lips after she gulped down another mouthful of food, but as she reached for her plate she found nothing was left. Levy was similarly dismayed for a brief moment, but the two were quickly gifted with the next course of their meal - plates and plates of pasta and meatballs. The two girls eyes' shone in delight at the sight, as if seeing a mystical treasure.

The two girls quickly dug into their food. Their forks moved quickly, fitting as much food into their respective mouths as there could be at any one time. Lucy gluttonously gobbled up generous helpings of food, with sauce staining her cheeks as she threw any sense of etiquette to the wind. She would immediately lick up any sauce left on her face, but only out of hunger rather than any embarrassment.

Levy was no less piggish, pushing ponderous portions of food between her plump lips. Large lumps could be seen in her throat as food flowed down through her system to be digested as fat. A part of her was tempted to even do away with her utensils and just shovel everything into her mouth with her hands, but she forced herself not to.

Lucy let out a brief belch after swallowing down another mouthful, causing her to blush as Levy chuckled bemusedly. Nevertheless, neither girl could afford to stop for more than a moment - the others around them proved gluttonous as well, devouring their own meals with a similar hunger. Still, Lucy and Levy felt almost as if they were only becoming more hungry the more they ate.

As soon as the last plate of pasta and meatballs was cleaned of its contents, the dessert arrived - servings of apple pie for both girls. Neither, of course, decided to waste their time.

Using the knives they'd been offered, both girls quickly divided their pies into six large slices and one by one, the girls would force entire slices of their dessert into their mouths. A few moments would pass for them to chew the delicious pies, but they were of course unable to savour the flavour for too long as quickly enough the mouthfuls of food would be swallowed down.

Gorging themselves, the two gluttonous girls were led by their greed to gobble up every last slice. 111221111211121111121112122111.content:
The spoons may as well have been shovels. In spite of how full their bellies felt and how much they had eaten, there was still something deep within that yearned for more. Even as they filled their mouths and swallowed down so much food, they wanted more. Even as they felt their clothes become tighter, they wanted more. Even as they felt their bodies becoming softer and heavier, they wanted more.

Lucy hungrily tossed chunks of the chocolate pudding into her mouth, gluttonously gulping it all down. Even as other duos looked to be pushed past their limits, Lucy didn't seem to have an end in sight. Her hunger simply begged her to eat more and more. Lucy was simply powerless to resist her hunger.

Levy, of course, was no different. The blue-haired girl simply couldn't stop herself from forcing mouthful after mouthful of the pudding down her own throat. She had passed the point of savouring food - now she just wanted to sate her hunger as quickly and effectively as possible.

The plates very quickly became empty. Bite after bite reduced the chocolate pudding down to smaller and smaller sizes until eventually not even a crumb was left of it. The girls sat back for a brief moment as the plates were taken away, with the ever-enthusiastic announcer looking eager to begin the final cycle.

"Alright folks, here we are! Only four duos left! Who will be the victors and take home the grand prize? Who ever lasts the longest wins! Lets begin the Final Cycle!" he declared with enthusiasm, pointing in the direction of the kitchens as now men wheeled out carts carrying the food for the Final Cycle. As they arrived at the tables they set down the starters of the Final Cycle before each of the duos - four servings of barbecued scallops for each of the duos.

Without a word, all four of the duos dug into their food. Lucy hungrily grabbed the skewers and tore the food from the skewer, trying to get it all into her stomach as quickly as possible. By all means she should have hit her limit long ago - Lucy had simply never felt this hungry, nor eaten this much food in one sitting. But something inside her willed her to eat and devour yet more and more food. Even why, by all rights, she should have stopped, she still kept eating.

Levy likewise dug into her starters, showing herself to be quite capable of keeping up with Lucy when it came to eating. Hands hungrily helped themselves to taking hold of food and cramming it into her mouth. In what was much like a flash, both girls had managed to leave the skewers looking completely bare, even as another duo ended up out of the competition, being unable to eat another bite. Almost instantly the officials took the empty plates from the duos and quickly began to bring out their main courses - whopping 28 inch diameter pizzas covered in mozzarella, tomatoes, mushrooms and pepperoni. Even as the other duos stared with concern, Lucy and Levy could only stare as their mouths watered.

Unable to control themselves the two girls grabbed slices of pizza and crammed their faces full. Muffled moans of gluttonous pleasure could only barely be heard past mouths stuffed with food. Each slice of pizza was like heavenly bliss, and they had more than enough of it to spare. Lucy and Levy both let themselves become like pigs as, even with their swollen stomachs and soft thighs, neither one looked any less hungry. On the contrary, it was as if being presented with such a huge helping of food just made them even hungrier.

Red stretchmarks made themselves known as their bodies just continued to pack on the pounds. Food was digested and converted into fat with each and every bite. But Lucy and Levy didn't notice, or maybe they didn't care. Even as the food showed its results on their bodies, the only thing that concerned them was devouring every last crumb and morsel of food. There was no longer even winning or losing. There was simply eating.

Slice by slice the pizza was getting smaller. What was once huge enough to feed a family was now dwindling down, becoming smaller and smaller. Now it was reduced to an almost pathetic shadow of its former self before the two gluttonous girls. And soon, even that was gone, leaving behind not even a scrap of food as the two girls devoured the last of it.

People watched in awe as another duo dropped out, leaving only two duos. But what fascinated them most were the two girls, previously unheard of in the realm of competitive eating. These two newcomers were outeating everyone else and it was putting people on edge with excitement. Now there was only one course left - dessert.

Before each duo was placed a pair of silver bowls, within which massive mountains of ice cream rested. Vanilla, strawberry and chocolate with a cherry on top - the sight awed the girls as they realized that these massive mounds of ice cream were for them. They didn't worry about not winning. That wasn't even on their minds. They might as well have forgotten they were in a competition - right now, there was only the meal.

Not even bothering with spoons, the two girls reached into the ice cream with their own hands and shoveled it into their gaping maws. Scooping up huge chunks of ice cream in their hands they hungrily swallowed each and every handful they could grasp. From time to time they'd lick their lips and slurp in all of the ice cream that stained their mouths, but then they'd eagerly grab more ice cream and devour.

They'd even lick their fingers and hands as they found there was still more to be had. They wanted everything. Their hunger for ever more pushed them to continue even past the limits of normal people. The other duo, even as they tried to keep up, found themselves in awe of the two girls as they simply ate without stop. And if the universe would allow it, possibly without end.

It was a tense few minutes as people watched, but soon it became abundantly clear there was no longer even a contest. Before the other duo had even finished half of their desserts, the two Fairy Tail girls had devoured everything, leaving even their bowls completely bare.

"This is incredible! Ladies and Gentlemen, the winners of our contest are the two newcomers; Lucy Heartfilia and Levy McGarden!" the announcer exclaimed passionately. The people in the audience cheered and clapped as both Lucy and Levy leaned back in their seats, with Levy letting out a loud belch as Lucy patted her stomach.

Lucy's figure had become big and round, with her belly being her biggest and roundest feature. Her face had become round and chubby and each breast looked almost as big as her own head, but her stomach bulged outwards, sitting in her lap like a large mound of flabby flesh. She could only just wrap her arms around her own middle, finding herself completely stuffed beyond belief.

Levy was pudgy in the middle and her chest was certainly big, but in contrast to Lucy her most prominent features were her bottom and thighs. She'd developed a pear-shaped figure from all of the stuffing and gorging and eating she'd done not just in the eating contest but in the whole day she'd spent eating non-stop. Her hips were wider than Lucy's, with her bottom like a pair of fluffy pillows. Her thighs rubbed together and Levy was certain that if she got up and walked, they would scrape against one another constantly.

But neither complained of the excess weight they'd gained, if anything, something akin to pride welled up within them both as they looked at their figures. They took pride in their gluttony.

No longer was her waist so narrow compared to her chest and behind - now, layers of pudge caused it to bloat outwards, the black fabric of her dress clinging tightly around the curves and love handles she now possessed. 12111.content:
"Hmmmm..." Erza pondered as she was looking at the S-Class job board. After winning the Magic Games and stopping the Dragon Invasion, jobs have been coming in like crazy thanks to Fairy Tail's rebounding popularity. In addition, getting the guild hall back and in original shape, no, actually better shape. The main hall is bigger, as is the upstairs. Lots of things are bigger now. And it's December too.

The redhead's eyes scrolled over the board for S-Class jobs. She wanted a challenge, something interesting and something worthwhile.

Then she spotted it, underneath a 'Find the Diamond Devil' flyer. She reached in a pulled out the pamphlet. It read:

HELP NEEDED! 100 YEAR FESTIVAL ABOUT TO BEGIN!

The 100 year festival is a festival that goes on for a year that occurs only once a century. In the town of Hazom in northern Caelum, the festival is to put on a celebration over the course of 5 years. It is a lovely tradition held by our people.

However, due to the festival's activities, it attracts various beasts to the town, and to be sure, the town has built walls around the perimeter in order to keep out monsters. However, our mayor needs actual help from a Guild with strong members who can help defend our town over the course of 5 years. Payment will be 30,000,000 Jewels per mage once a year to whoever helps defend our town over the course of these 5 years. Room, boarding, and utilities will be provided for free, and food and other wares, such as clothes bought within the village will be given to you for 50%. You will be given the 10 million Jewels at the end of the year.

Please come by December 25th. The 100 year Festival begins on January 1st, X792

Erza pondered...this job is clearly one for the long haul, and one that is quite profitable indeed. Thirty million a year! And free room and boarding along with the products bought inside the village fifty percent off. Quite the deal.

However, this was a SS-Class job, mainly due to it's length of time. And who knows what monsters lay down in the southern nation of Caelum?

If Gildarts were to become as strong as Makarov due to taking these jobs. So can she. But...who to take along with her? Natsu, Gray, Wendy, and Gajeel were called away to meet this Warrod Cken person, so that leaves...

Erza smiled. "I got it!"

She will invite Lucy! Along with...
12111.title: It begins! The 5 Year Quest!

121111.content:
"You want me to what?!?" Lucy exclaimed at Erza's request. The blonde was stunned at the fact that Erza would want to pick her to go on this job, which given it's rank, Lucy figured it was going to be really dangerous. Granted Lucy had been through an awful lot since joining Fairy Tail, and the pacts that she had made with so many of her spirits meant she wasn't some weakling, but she couldn't help but feel she would still be slowing Erza down in some way.

"Of course Lucy. You were my first choice!" Erza said as she patted the celestial mage on her back. It really didn't help make her feel much better honestly. As Lucy just sighed in response, a blue haired girl approached the two of them.

"Juvia is very thankful you would choose her too for this dangerous quest. This will be a chance for Juvia to prove herself to Gray-sama!" the blue haired water mage exclaimed with stars in her eyes as a day dream played out in her head. This would be just what she needed to finally get Gray's attention: Coming back from a super serious SS rank job. As Lucy continued her sulking and Juvia kept up with her daydream, Mirajane walked to the group, curious about all the fuss they were causing

"So you decided to take that job huh? Master Makarov thought it would be to your liking!" she said with a smile. It was almost funny to think that she and Erza had been bitter rivals when they were little.

"I'm glad you are here Mirajane: I want you to come with the 3 of us as well. It would add to an already impeccable team," Erza said, the excitement beginning to build up in her. Mirajane just sighed in response to this.

"I would love nothing more than to come with you Erza... but the guild needs me to keep things up around here! I can't imagine what would happen if I left..." Mirajane's crestfallen face. Erza was about to object when a voice managed to do it for her.

"Go on the job!" It belonged to none other than the Master Makavrov. As the tiny wizard walked next to Mirajane, he grabbed her hand to reassure her. "You're done more than enough for this guild Mira. You deserve to get out there and spread your wings every once in a while! Besides Natsu and Gray are gone so you don't need to worry about any commotion." Mirajane just smiled and giggled slightly in response and turned back to Erza.

"Well I guess that settles it: I will gladly join you on this job Erza!" Now that the pieces were in place and the group had been assembled (although Lucy was still whining, Erza never knew her to back down), they were all ready to go to this land and start the job.
121111.title: Mirajane and Juvia!

choices: "Sure thing Lucy. I'll see you tonight after I pack."
"Why not bring Mirajane and Juvia too?"
1211111.content:
"Okay then, so this job is in Northern Caelum, which is south of," pondered Mirajane as the girls gathered around at a table. "So we need boat tickets to get to this town and then we need to travel to there."

"Yeah. This is going to be one long mission, one lasting five years," added Erza. "So bring along-"

"Ehhh! Five years!" Gasped Juvia. "But what if Gray-sama were to-" Then, Juvia's imagination began to run wild. Images of Gray waiting by the shoreline for her every day...and with her looking out to sea from Caelum every day. She was grasped her cheeks and gave out a "waaaah...". But then it hit her...

Such a strong quest, Gray-sama would finally confess his love to her at long last! And the years would only make the reunion sweeter. Who knows, he may even send letters! Distance makes the heart grow more fonder after all.

"Okay! Juvia is in!" Chirped Juvia, hand on the table.

"You're certainly excited," commented Lucy with a raised eye. The bluenette gave an about face began walking out.

"Juvia is going to pack a lot of her things for this trip! Erza, we meet up when?"

Erza put a hand on her chin, pondering. "How about tomorrow afternoon. We'll take a train to Hargeon Town then take our boat to Caelum. The boat ride will take about a day or so, so when we arrive in Caelum it will be morning or afternoon."

"Sounds like a plan," said Mirajane. "I will do the same and tell Lisanna and Elfman." She stood up and walked out with Juvia towards Fairy Hills.

"So..." The two of Team Natsu's teenage females were alone. Lucy scratched her chin. "I guess I'll do the same? Also, Erza, we should do something before we leave."

"Something?" Erza asked. "Like what?"

"Well...it's going to be a five year quest, so we won't be home for a long time. I will even need to put all of my stuff into a storage unit as I won't be able to maintain my apartment with me gone. So...before we leave, want to do something fun? Like, have a girls night out for dinner?"

The redhead smiled at the blonde's suggestion. "I'd be happy to Lucy. You are one of my dearest friends after all. Know of a place to go?"

"There's this nice hole in the wall down town. We can head there."

As she filled her suitcases with all manner of food, costumes, and trinkets, the mountain that was Erza Scarlet's luggage was once again complete. She stood back from her handiwork and took a glance to make sure nothing was forgotten.

"Oh! how could I have been so dumb!" She said as she realized she had forgotten her 'spare souvenir' case, because who knows what sort of amazing trinkets she was going to find on this long journey. Satisfied with her packing, she looked at the time and figured she may as well get ready and go meet up with Lucy at the guild. Quickly requipping into one of her many dresses ( this one a tight purple one that showed off a fair amount of her generous cleavage), Erza began her walk to Fairy Tail, eager to see what sort of place Lucy had picked out for their girls night.

"Whatever it is, I hope they have cake," Erza remarked to herself as she licked her lips. It was well known she had a dangerous sweet tooth and wasn't above ordering massive amounts of sweets.
