"Okay, I guess we'll eat here then," said Lucy walking up towards a happy Erza. The redhead wasted no time, tugging Lucy along and heading inside and grabbing a table. Erza waved her hand for a waiter to come by and order the all-you-can-eat option.

121111111112.content:
The moon had already risen over Magnolia by the time the two girls exited the buffet, leaning on each other for support.

"I don't think I'll be hungry again for at least five years," Lucy groaned. Erza nodded in agreement. "I don't think I could eat another slice of cake if one fell from the sky."

She paused and looked up. Lucy laughed.

"Are you sure? You looked like you were thinking about it!"

Erza shook her head. "No, I thought I heard--nevermind. We'd better get back home if we want to keep out schedule."

"You said it!" Lucy yawned. "I'm about ready to pass out!"

"So am I, but I don't dare. If I went right to bed after all that, I'd probably wake up too fat to fight."

"D-don't worry so much," Lucy said around another jaw-cracking yawn. "We're ...in good... shape, once won't... hurt..."

She stretched her arms over her head and moaned with exhaustion and fullness, arcing her back. Her breasts lifted, and her distended abdomen flexed as muscles tightened and shifted around the mass of food. There was a snapping noise.

"Oh, no!" Lucy exclaimed.

"What?"

"Nothing," the blonde said hastily. "I mean... not nothing, exactly... more like I just lost the button on my shorts!"

"Oh, is that all?"

"I just bought these! Help me look for it!"

"Is that is?" Erza pointed to the gleam of metal in a patch of moonlight.

"Yes!" Lucy waddled forward awkwardly. "Could you grab it for me? Er, because you're closer."

"It is your button."

"But you're the one who saw it!"

"But it's your button."

"But..." Lucy blushed. "I don't think I can bend at the waist right now, okay?"

Erza sighed and rubbed her bulging abdomen. "And I'm so full I can barely breathe, let alone bed."

"So what do I doooo?" Lucy wailed, holding her shorts up with one hand. "I wish I could just requip like you can!"

"Right now, I think the only thing I could requip into would be a pair of sweat pants." Erza covered her mouth and belched softly into the back of her hand. Burr-ff. "Make that a pair of extra-large sweat pants."

"I guess there's no helping it," Lucy shrugged. "Open, Gate of the Celestial--"

"You're using your magic for that?"

"You're right!" Lucy said, pounding her fist into her hand. "The only spirits I have available right now are ones I ... don't really want to see me in this situation. Loke... and Aquarius... and Taurus... brr! If I wait until midnight I can call Plue and--"

Erza held up a hand. "Somebody's coming."

A few moments later, a pair of sleazy-looking thugs stepped out of the shadows.

"I thought so," Erza said. "You've been following us for a while, haven't you?"

The biggest thug grinned, revealing a crooked graveyard of white and yellow teeth. "Long enough to tell by your stumbles that you two are too drunk to do anything but hand over your money. Let's have it, now."

"We are not drunk," Erza said. "We are full of cake. And you will not get a single jewel from us."

"M-maybe we should just give them the money," Lucy murmured. "They're pretty tough-looking, and neither of us is really in shape to fight..."

As first thug stepped forward, Erza drew her sword in one quick movement and slammed the flat into the side of the thug's misshapen head. The sword flashed again, and the second thug yiped in terror as his pants slipped down around his ankles. He abandoned his friend, running for the safety of the shadows, tripping over the cloth in his flight.

"Wow," Lucy said.

"I can't bend at the waist, but as long as I can move my arms, there's no problem." Erza burped again, then held her sword out to Lucy. It took the girl a moment to recognize the object held at its point.

"It seems like his tailor uses the same brand of buttons your does," the redhead said. "Not that you need it, apparently."

Lucy looked down. Beneath her generous chest, the shorts were holding tight to her waist.

"Fortunately for you, you're too bloated for them to slip," Erza observed.

Lucy sighed. "Yeah, lucky me."

Gray nearly did a double take as he spotted her, practically jumping out of his skin. "Woah!"

"Does Gray-sama wish to know what Juvia thinks?" Juvia asked, her eyes wide and expecting. The dark-haired male found himself at a bit of a loss for words, but fortunately the last member of the group was willing to step in and voice her own opinion.

"It's... Interesting..." the red-head clad in armour mused, catching the attention of the other three. "They must have been really good sculptors...".

"The quality of the sculpting isn't what everyone's thinking about, Erza..." Cana, the brunette, remarked. "But either way, I guess this is where our mission begins...".

"Juvia will be sure to do her best!" the blue-haired woman spoke up with a wide smile, releasing Gray's arm for a moment. The young man took the opportunity to take a step or two away, but Juvia paid it no heed. Although certainly... Enamored with Gray, the truth was that Juvia was also eager to take on the mission out of a sense of pride. She hadn't actually done many missions as a team with the other members of Fairy Tail - most so far had been low-level missions done to pay for her rent. But now she was faced with an opportunity to show what she was capable of in a big mission.

Although, the blue-haired woman wouldn't also deny that she was eager to show what she was capable of to Gray. It was little secret that Juvia harbored feelings for Gray, but she worried a lot about whether or not he returned those feelings. She wasn't sure if this was necessarily the best way to grasp his attention, but if Juvia could show Gray how dedicated she was, perhaps he'd at least take interest in her.

"Let's go in and get this done with," Gray remarked, stepping ahead. With a smile and a nod Juvia quickly followed behind, heading for the doors to the tower. Cana and Erza both followed behind the two, both ready to unleash their magic if it came to it. As Gray and Juvia pressed against the large, heavy doors, they began to slowly push them open and wander into the inner chambers of the tower.
153112.title: Magic.

1531121.content:
The group walked inside the dark tower, the darkness seemingly endless aside from the light of the door shining past the chamber. They can see what was directly across from the door, as they saw a murky dirt wall. Otherwise, it was completely dark.

“Oui, Cana,” Gray asked turning towards the tall brunette. “Got a spell to make a light?”

“Way ahead of ya Gray,” Cana reached into her pocket and brought out one of her Tarot Cards. “Lamp Card!”

Her card began to shine a light, as if was a flashlight through the darkness. Cana used the light to sweep across the dark chamber. She took note of the cobwebs and dust, but nothing particularly of note.

Except for scriptures on the wall showing feminine figures in various poses and stances.

“I wonder why all of these women are posed like that,” pondered Erza as she Requiped into an archeological get up, with deep brown shorts with pockets, a dark blue shirt exposing some cleavage, and a beige jacket and a white hat. She had a magnifying glass on hand looking deep into the stone.

“Beats me. All I know is that the guys before us tried to climb this tower but couldn’t reach the top,” replied Gray, hands in his pockets as he looked around, Juvia sticking by his side also observing the architecture of the chamber.

“Didn’t they say that their memories were erased or something?” Commented the Bluenette. “Maybe something in this tower wipes the memory of those it-“
Juvia paled. She couldn’t even bring herself to finish that sentence. If her memory were to be erased…

She would lose her precious Gray-Sama that she deeply carves and etches into her head every day! She can’t lose all of her precious memories of her Gray-Sama! She cannot! She absolutely cannot!

“Uhhh…Juvia?” Gray looked down and saw Juvia gripping his hand harder than usual as her face looked as if she has seen a ghost. “You alright?”

Before Juvia could respond, Cana spoke up. “Hey! I found a door!” Said the brunette as she was searching for anything of a door and came across another small wooden door. The Fairy Tail magi gathered close by and inspected the door, seeing that it had a lock.

Yet it also had-

“Look, a letter!” Erza said as she took the piece of paper that was nailed to the door and Cana got up behind her to shine her Lamp Card onto it.

IF YOU VALUE YOUR(inllegible writing) DON’T GO UP!!

“Value what? Your life?” Asked Juvia as she stepped in with Gray.

“I don’t think that’s it. Otherwise we would have never heard of this place. Everyone that has gone in has come out.”

“Gray’s right,” surmised Erza. “Something we value…how curious…” then a big grin came to her face. “Let’s go!”

“W-Wait! Maybe we should think this through,” Juvia said nervously, turning around and had her hands on cheeks. “I mean, Juvia would like to keep her memory of Gray-Sama and meeting Gray-Sama and seeing all the times Gray-Sama stripped intact and-“

While she was on a mini rant, the others opened the door, and saw a white mist.

“Who first?” Asked Gray as he looked towards the two girls, Cana took a step back. This got her stares from the two members of Team Natsu.

“What? I’m not exactly a bruiser like you two. Besides, I got to keep my delicate skin in tact~.”

Gray rolled his eyes and turned towards Erza.

“So, want me to go in first? Or do you want to first?”
1531121.title: The inside is eerily quiet.

choices: We see what Erza and Cana are up to...
15311212.content:
After a few moments of careful discussion, Gray decided to head in first. The reasoning had been that Gray's defensive abilities were the greatest of the group, meaning he could fend off any kind of surprise frontal assault.

Stepping in through the mists that escaped the doorway the dark-haired mage wandered into the unknown territory beyond. His eyes looked around, trying to see past the strange mists that surrounded him. He began to frown as he continued walking. Nothing had shown up yet, but he couldn't be too cautious. This tower was a mysterious place, after all. Maybe no one who had gone in had died, but it was definitely well worth keeping his guard up.

The mists were slowly beginning to fade and just at the end of the corridor he could see some faint light from the end of the mists. Gray began to stride towards it, but he found himself stopping as footsteps raced behind him. He turned just in time for another body to collide with him and begin embracing him tightly, nearly knocking the breath out of his lungs.

"J-Juvia-!" he exclaimed in shock. He looked down to see the blue-haired woman in the dark coat squeezing him tightly, practically crushing his ribcage with how tightly she held on.

"Juvia cannot allow Gray-sama to go alone! Juvia is worried-!" the blue haired woman was cut off as Gray took hold of her by the forearms, trying to release the pressure on his lungs.

"I'm fine!" he insisted. For a moment the young woman stared, her face turning slightly red for a second as she released her hold and stepped back, attempting to maintain a smile in spite of her own embarrassment. She could not afford to turn Gray-sama away, after all.

"Juvia is sorry," she remarked as he released her, wishing for a moment that he hadn't let go. He turned around and stared back up the corridor. Juvia stepped to the side to gaze a whatever had caught his attention, only to soon realize that it was evidently a way out.

"Another room?" Juvia asked, a brow raised. Gray shrugged.

"It's something," he remarked as he began to wander down the corridor. Quickly following his lead Juvia walked alongside him, briefly basking in the knowledge that right now she had Gray all to herself.As the two neared the end of the corridor the mists finally began to fade away, revealing a new room.

It was a large, circular room adorned with pillars, atop which stood statues of women. The women were all posed differently, but each seemed to possess a curvier look to their figure than the previous statues they had seen before. Little else stood out within the room, but what they did notice was a door on the other side. It looked large and heavy - not the kind one could simply smash straight through - but above the door was a plaque. The plaque didn't have any kind of ornate sign, but upon it was written a number - 100. What did that mean? Gray frowned as he tried to figure it out.

Meanwhile, Juvia stared at a panel on the floor just in front of the large door, her brow raised in curiosity. It was very slightly raised up from the rest of the floor tiles, almost like a button waiting to be pressed. Although, given how big it was, it almost resembled a weighing scale.

"What is this?" Juvia wondered aloud to herself. This tower was most certainly not what it seemed...
15311212.title: Gray goes in first...with Juvia!?

choices: They reach the next room, and the weight for opening the door is higher!
Some playful banter as they climbed the stair case.
153112121.content:
The moment Juvia stepped on the panel, it shifted, pressing down the floor and making a large noise, like how stone rubs off against rock.

"So help me, if a giant boulder comes crashing down I am going to punch a baby," groused Gray, looking around and fully alert. Juvia was in the same state of mind as well, ready to use her magic to save Gray-sama no matter what!

Instead the rock shifting stopped and suddenly, white runes appeared in the center room, gaining the attention of the two mages. "Eh? Runes?"

Then the runes began to shift, and the panel Juvia stepped on glowed briefly. Then the runes shifted.

Name: Juvia
Weight: 120

The bluentte grabbed her cheeks and blushed. How can such a machine tell her weight like that! No Gray-sama will-

Then more runes appeared.

100 is required. 120 is fulfilled.

"What? 120 is fulfilled?" Pondered Gray outloud.

"Hey!" Said Erza's voice, causing the Ice and Water magi to turn their heads, and here come Erza and Cana. "Looks like that white light wasn't so harmless after all."

"Yeah," Cana said, pointing back there and looking around the room. "Got to say, the architecture is top notch. These girls look more sexier than the ones in the last room."

"Curious indeed, but chances are it is probably a coincidence," said Erza. The door then began to open, adjacent from them as the stone slab rose. "How did that get open?"

"Juvia stepped on that scale thingy. And boom. Turns out the unlocking mechanism for these doors is affected by weight," said Gray as Juvia came to join him.

"It even told Juvia's weight too...and right in public..." Cana wrapped her arm around the depressed bluenette.

"Hey easy there girl. Doesn't change you are inside. Besides, I'm 125 pounds! Nothing to worry about Juvia!" Said the brunette smiling proudly.

'Probably from the extra beer weight,' commented Gray mentally.

"Indeed. I weigh heavier myself, though it's from muscle mostly. Now," Erza said turning towards the dark hallway which leads into a staircase. "Let's continue. That artifact isn't going to collect itself."
153112121.title: Juvia steps on the panel

choices: They step off, just in time.  But how to get through the door?
1531121211.content:
At the top of the next staircase was another room, almost identical to the first, except for the statues, which were even curvier, verging on chubby, and the number above the door, which read 140.

Juvia sighed. "Gray-sama, Juvia regrets that her slim, attractive figure is no longer of any use. Juvia concedes and admits she must leave things up to fatter girls like Cana from now on."

Cana pursed her lips. "So happy I comforted you earlier. Besides, I'm still fifteen pounds shy, remember?"

Gray shrugged, walking forward. "I'll handle it."

As soon as he stepped on the plate, the room filled with red light, and a sound like air being forced through dusty organ pipes reverberated through the air.

"Gray! Get off the plate!" Erza cried as the ice mage pulled his foot back. She approached it, looking concerned.

"I believe we're dealing with something similar to Jutsu-Shiki," she said. "Think of it like a cell with the requirements, 'only those who can match or exceed this weight may pass'. It's...more archaic, more primitive, obviously. And if one person passes, it lets us all through. But the principals are the same."

"So why didn't it like me?" Gray said. "I weigh over a hundred and forty easily, without clothes."

"Juvia is thinking of Gray-sama without clothes! Juvia's maidenly nose is leaking liquid love sauce!"

Ignoring the water mage and her nosebleed, Erza looked around the room. "There must be unwritten rules. If I had to guess, then based on all these statues I'd say that it only accepts women."

She took a deep breath.

"There's only one way to find out if I'm right."

Erza stepped forward on the plate.

Name: Erza
Weight: 139

And then, moments later:

140 is required. 139 is fulfilled.

The door didn't budge.

"Odd," Ezra said. "I should weigh much more than that with my armor. Maybe it's sophisticated enough to only count actual female flesh."

Cana grinned. "No problem! A little more female flesh, coming up!"

She hopped onto the plate behind Erza, snuggling into position.

"Wait!" Erza said. "I don't think it will let us both--"

The room was drenched in crimson once more, and filled with the same low, tooth-rattling blast. Erza tried to step back just as Cana tried to step forward, with the result that neither moved from the plate. Dust began to drift down from the ceiling.
1531121211.title: Working Out the Rules

choices: They come to the next room, this time with 2 stone plates
Erza continues to gain as time passes
Erza gets addicted to the sweet water
15311212111.content:
"Look out!"

Erza and Cana leaped to either side just as a beam of purple light, charged with crackling electric energy, descended down over the stone plate. The two narrowly avoided the beam, and stood up off the ground as the light flickered and vanished.

"I don't know what that beam does," Gray commented "but I'm not in a hurry to find out."

"That was a bit too close for comfort, I admit." Erza said, brushing dust off her shirt. "but since none of us meet the weight requirements, what do we do?"

"Juvia suggests we leave and go home so that Juvia and Gray-sama can rest and recover together!" Juvia shouted.

"Oh, shut up. You weren't even close to getting hurt." Cana snapped

The four suddenly paused and looked around as the low rumbling of running water started to reverberate through the room. A statue of a woman holding a vase began to gently pour pinkish-coloroed water from the opening of the vase into a small canal that ran the perimeter of the room. The liquid sparkled and shone as it filled the small rut and flowed around the edge of the chamber, eventually reaching a drain on the opposite side of the room and flowing back out, making a small stream running in a circle around the group. A chime sounded, and the runes above the door shifted to form new words.

Requirements not currently met.
Please drink until requirements have been fulfilled

"What the hell...?" Cana wore a mildly dumbfounded expression reading the words "Please drink? I guess it means the pink stuff, but..."

"Interesting... I suppose we are left with little choice. We have no reason to trust this setup, but it would be an odd way to poison a person, and I see no other way to proceed" Erza summoned a goblet with her requip and filled it with the sweet smelling fluid. "There are risks to consider, but I see no other way to progress. Cheers."

Ezra took a quick, decisive sip of the water in her glass before any of the others had a chance talk her out of it. The moment the liquid entered her mouth, the armored mage's eyes widened. This was the most delicious thing she had ever tasted! It was like a thousand strawberry shortcakes having a tea party in her mouth. Ezra quickly downed the whole goblet, not even stopping for breath until the entire glass had been consumed.

With each gulp, Erza's body changed. Her hips grew subtly wider, her belly softer, her breasts bigger. Even her face was more cherubic and her arms and legs less toned. The changes were subtle enough that Gray, Cana, and Juvia almost didn't notice them, but notice them they did. A single glass of the pink water flowing around the room had made their friend gain almost five whole pounds right in front of their eyes. The three were stunned, only snapping out of it once Erza wiped her mouth and breathed a sigh of shear pleasure.

"Ah... quite delicious." She said, subconsciously tugging at the edge of her shirt "Oh? My clothes feel a bit tight... What are you all looking at?"

Cana was the first to speak up: "You just gained a bunch of weight all at once! Don't tell me you didn't notice!"

"Now that you mention it, I am a bit pudgier. I expected as much. This tower seems to be designed to make those who don't meet the weight requirements gain weight until they do."

"What the hell kind of twisted security system is that?!"

"I don't know. But we may need to gain progressively more weight as we go in order to proceed. I am happy to take this burden for the group, if need be."

"Oh thank goodness!" Juvia chimed in "Juvia was worried she would be expected to become a butterball as well!"

"Don't let your guard down, Juvia." Erza replied "We still don't know what lies ahead." The slightly heavier girl stepped onto the stone plate, and the runes read

Name: Erza
Weight: 143

140 is required. 143 is fulfilled

"Shall we move on?"
15311212111.title: They step off, just in time.  But how to get th...

choices: Just barely don't meet the requirements
153112121111.content:
The group traveled up to the next floor, Erza breathing a bit heavier than normal as she went up the stairs. The mage had requipped out of her heavy armor and into normal, if slightly snug, clothing in order to relieve some of the burden of her extra pounds. A heavy sigh escaped her mouth as they reached the top of the stairs.
"Uh oh..."Gray said as she entered the next chamber. The rest of the group knew exactly what he was concerned about: in the center of the room was not one, but two stone squares, and the plaque above the door showed three numbers. In the center read in large font: 350. The bottom corners of the plaque showed two smaller numbers, in both quantity and font size, 180 and 150.
"What the heck is this?!" Cana shouted "So now two of us have to get big? What are all these extra numbers?"
"I suspect that the 350 in the middle is the total combined weight requirement of both women, and the smaller numbers are the minimum weights of the individuals." Erza deduced "This tower is quickly becoming problematic."
"NO! Juvia doesn't want to become fat! Juvia wants to stay skinny and sexy for Gray-sama!" the water mage clung to her beloved's arm, as Gray attempted to shake her off.
"Yeah, I'm not thrilled about sacrificing my waistline either." Cana said "Are we sure this is worth it? Maybe we should turn back now before the weight requirements get too high."
Erza rubbed her hand against the layer of softness on her stomach. She knew she should be worried about losing her warrior's physique, but part of her - a large part of her - wanted to keep going, not just to see what was at the top of this strange place, but because she almost liked the idea of growing bigger, curvier, having more presence.
"Juvia, Cana, we were hired to do a job. Are we so vain that a little fat will discourage us from keeping our word? We are members of Fairy Tail, and that means that we have a reputation that must be upheld."
"What?" Cana exclaimed "You're nuts! Gray, can you please help me talk some sense into her?"
Gray looked to the side "Actually... Erza has a point. We have a job to do, and we have to see it through. I'd volunteer if I could, but this place doesn't seem to care for men, so..."
Cana sighed. She wasn't getting out of this one. "Fine, but you owe me big time."
The tarot mage and the requip mage stepped onto the plates, Erza on the 180 plate since she was the heavier of the two, and the magic text appeared:

350 total is required. 268 is fulfilled
Name: Erza Weight: 143 Requirement: 180
Name: Cana Weight: 125 Requirement: 150
Requirements not currently met, please eat until requirements have been fulfilled

A table materialized before the two wizards, and on it was a massive sheet cake that covered it's surface, iced in pink frosting the same color as the water from the previous floor. Erza stepped forward and summoned a pair of plates and eating utensils, handing Cana one of each. The red-haired woman dug in immediately, but Cana hesitated. Steeling herself, she finally cut a piece of cake and began to eat.
The two women devoured the entire cake within minutes, drawn in by the sheer sweet flavor that it shared with the drink from the floor below. As they ate, they grew curvier, clothes strained and the weight piled on.
Erza's hips grew wider and her legs touched together, her breasts and arms were laden with fat, but they were insignificant compared to her large gut, which hung down over her crotch. She flinched a little as a button on her shirt popped off of the large dome, but quickly resumed feasting.
Cana was smaller than Erza, and didn't eat quite as fast, but she was still getting pretty large. Her butt stuck out several inches and pushed against her skinny jeans. Her thighs did the same. Her stomach was just a small potbelly compared to Erza's gut, but her boobs were easily bigger despite the other woman's head start. Her bra squished into her back fat and caused her boobs to squeeze together to form a black hole of cleavage.
Once the cake was gone, the two women
153112121111.title: They come to the next room, this time with 2 st...

choices: Juvia steps on the panel and gets weighed again
Cana or Erza step on the panel before she can
1531121212.content:
As the quartet went up the stairs, Gray vaguely noticed the marking on the wall next to him. It started out as a thin line barely the width of his finger, that swirled and curved up and down, gaining height with each step they took. But as they neared the end of the staircase, the line got thicker and thicker, smaller lines seeming to join it, to conglomerate into one larger piece. It looked really cool, he thought. The only sounds they heard though, were of their steps on the stone and the clanking of Erza's armor as she moved. He didn't like silence that much.

"So, once we do this, anyone planning to do anything special with the reward we're going to get?" Gray asked. Cana shrugged.

"Beer, probably. Mira got on my case again for drinking too much of the guild's stock, so I'm going to go at least a day or two just going through my own brews so she backs down some, you know how she gets," the scantily-clad woman said.

"Clothing for me," Erza said. "There are some new Heart Kreuz pieces coming out soon that I think look quite nice."

"Don't you already have a million clothes anyway?" Gray asked.

"Not even near that many," Erza said. "Right now I have about 85 sets of armor, and only about twenty or so pairs of casual clothes," she retorted.

"Ah, sorry," Gray said. "What about you, Juvia?" he asked.

"Mmm, Juvia isn't sure, but does Gray have any idea what Juvia should buy?" she asked, holding her hands together and looking up at him.

"Well, I doubt you'd want what I was thinking, since it's, oh, we're here," Gray said. It didn't seem like he was intentionally putting off what he intended, but was just focused on the mission. "So, what do you think, the last one needed 100 pounds, so this is probably 110 or maybe 120, so you can probably do it again Juvia."

"Oh, if Gray-sama wishes it," the blue-haired mage said, going to step on the panel.
1531121212.title: Some playful banter as they climbed the stair c...

choices: They do Rock-paper-scissors to decide who gains
15311212121.content:
Juvia stepped on the panel, gulping nervously as she did so. She heard the rock shifting stopped and suddenly, the white runes appeared before them.

Then the runes began to shift, and the panel Juvia stepped on glowed briefly. Then the runes shifted.

Name: Juvia
Weight: 120
130 is required. 120 is fulfilled.

"Ehhhh!" Juvia gasped out loud. "A thirty pound jump!"

"So it would seem..." Erza pondered as she cupped her cheek. "Step off and let me give it a try." The bluenette looked back and obliged, allowing the redhead to step on. The runes appeared and did their work.

Name: Erza
Weight: 139
130 is required. 130 fulfilled.

And the door began to open, leading to to bright light within the other room.

"See? Doesn't seem like THAT much of an issue," Erza stepped into the room with her hands on her hips, the group following after her as they took note of the room and their eyes got readjusted to the light. They all gasped.

It was some sort of pool of sorts, with plump feminine statues pouring out the water from their vases. And to the side were several beds against the wall. On the other side...

"Oh hey! Food!" Cana said in surprise as she went over to check it out. Erza and Gray were looking over the place.

"This place looks..."

"Odd..." Erza finished for Gray. The Ice Mage's eyes then saw the other door and his eyes rose up.

Bright words saying 150 were above the door, along with the same panel and runes. "Oui, Erza. See that?"

"I do," commented the armor mage. "It would seem...that we're may need to put on a few if we are to get to the higher floors."

"Gray-sama, what do we do then?"

"You heard Erza, one of you is gonna need to put on a couple of pounds," shrugged the black haired teen. Juvia pouted. If this keeps up, her figure is going to be ruined for sure!

"Hey Cana! We're going to need to-" He was cut off by the sound of Cana falling on the bed in enjoyment. "Oui! Cana!" That finally got her attention.

"Whats up?"

"We're going to need to draw straws," Erza suggested. "Who is going to gain to get on that panel."

"Or we can play rock paper scissors. I don't see us having any straws," Gray commented.

"You can make them with Ice Make remember?"

"Well, RPS would be more fun though."
15311212121.title: Juvia steps on the panel and gets weighed again

choices: Erza wins, she has a shorter distance to reach the target weight.
Cana wins, time to stuff until she's heavy enough.
153112121211.content:
"I say we play Rock Paper Scissors. Gray could easily cheat and give whoever of us he likes the least the longer straw," Cana said with a smirk.

"Hey, I'd never do that, I like all of you exactly the same," Gray said. Juvia's eyes widened and she looked at Erza and Cana.

"Exactly the same?" Juvia muttered, blushing. "Gray-sama likes them the same, as much as he likes Juvia." Her face got heated, a bit of steam starting to come out of her head. "Gray-sama wants all three of us?" she mumbled.

"Alright, Rock Paper Scissors then. Well, wait, who's going to eat, the person who beats the other two or the first one to lose to the others?" Gray said.

"Well whoever is the 'winner' is going to get a nice feast, so I say that's a worthy prize," Cana said, smiling.

"Very well," Erza decided, crossing her arms. "The winner of both matches shall have to fatten themselves for the mission. Are you ready? Juvia!"

"Yes!" the bluenette said, walking over to Erza.

"I assume you know how to play?"

"Yes!" Juvia said, taking a breath. She and Erza threw their arms down at the count of three, leaving Juvia with scissors and Erza with rock. "No! Darn, I'm so sorry, Gray-samaaa," she started to whine, and Gray just rubbed his forehead.

"Just, try and beat Cana or something then," he said, throwing up his arms. Juvia nodded, and Cana shook her shoulder to get ready for the match. She and Juvia both picked paper the first time, but Cana won their second go.

"Woo, alright, Erza, ready to lose?" she said with a smirk. Erza glared at her, the redhead never turned down a challenge. The two young women counted to three and threw down their hands.
153112121211.title: They do Rock-paper-scissors to decide who gains

choices: Juvia takes a bite, and becomes addicted to it!
Cana and Gray stop her, speculating that the food is addictive.
1531121212111.content:
"And I win." Smirked Erza, holding up rock. Cana picked scissors and shrugged.

"Hey it's your funeral. I mean, you're the one gaining some thunder thighs here." The redhead chuckled.

"Fool, don't underestimate my weight losing abilities. I will shed the muffin top in no time." The Swords Mage walked over and spotted the glowing feast right before them. And the food glowed into existence...

"OH! EM! GOOOOOD!" Erza squeeled in delight. Upon the wide table...was numerous Strawberry Cakes! "Whoever is in charge thank you thank you thank you!" She pleaded and pounced, but stopped herself, picking up a plate elegantly and taking a cake slice as if she was at a high class party...Before taking a bite...

Which turned to her shoveling her spoon into her mouth at a breakneck pace, tears streaming down her eyes.

"Ith delithus!" She moaned as she began to stuff her face at a frantic pace. Gray and Cana were surprised by her...enthusiasm.

"Whoa. I knew Erza liked strawberry cakes...but this is insane!" Commented Cana with wide eyes.

"You tell me." Added the black haired Ice Mage. "Say, where's Juvia?" They looked around and spotted the bluenette holding a plate.

"Hmmm...if Erza likes it so much, maybe Juvia can try a bite?"
1531121212111.title: Erza wins, she has a shorter distance to reach ...

choices: Let the two stuff themselves until they can't anymore.
Try to pull them away from the food.
15311212121111.content:
Juvia walked over to the table where a buffet's worth of strawberry cakes had been placed before the redheaded mage. It wasn't all the same time of cakes either. She saw full triple-layer cakes with thick coatings of vanilla frosting that covered the pink treat. There were doubly-pink cupcakes with tiny halves of strawberries on top, and servings of strawberry shortcake with thick red berry glaze. Thick cheesecakes with pink swirls of pure fruit flavor and sugar, souffles that looked remarkably light with caramelized strawberries on top, and some more foreign-looking treats as well, all piled high with fresh, ripe strawberries, fluffy scoops of cream, and tiny other decorations as well. The whole display look like something that would take days to fully put together. And at the rate she was going, Erza looked like she would devour it all in a fraction of that time. But, Juvia wouldn't mind some cake as well. She walked over to grab a cupcake and stick it on her plate. A fork grasped firmly in Erza's hand slammed down on the plate and knocked the cupcake off, right into Erza's waiting hand.

"My... cakes..." Erza said between bites of the cupcake. Her cheeks were constantly puffed up from having so much pastry in her mouth. Juvia backed up, holding the plate up to her face and covering up everything except her eyes.

"Juvia just wanted a bite... there's plenty of food..." she said, sniffling.

"Come on Erza, let her have some if she wants to eat," Gray said. "Cana can have some too if she wants."
