1553321111.content:
How cruel is fate?

Angel, the former member of the dark guild, Oración Seis, had to honestly contemplate this more than once. In the past, she was one of many who were subject to being imprisoned in the "Tower of Heaven" where she (would have) been used to revive some important old crone she knew nothing about. However, she had managed to get out of this during the slave revolt in the tower and, after meeting Brain, became a member of one of the most powerful dark guilds in Earth Land. For a time, things were good for her; she had freedom, power and a chance to enjoy herself for once...until she met her defeat, that is. After that, Angel was captured and imprisoned yet again, but was done so for her own involvement with the very dark guild she saw as her salvation...

Despite Angel's disdain for being where she was, it was clear that it was here in prison she would remain. Time marches on and after seven long years, nothing seems to have changed for the so called 'fallen Angel'. Sure, there were a few occasional prison riots accompanied by the same fools who believed that could escape the walls of this magically enchanted prison. For a time, Angel sought entertainment and even a little hope in these occasional upsets in order. To her, it was good to see the regular escape attempt as this gave her a chance see if she could do the same by analyzing their methods and gauging their success. Unfortunately, the numerous efforts of other prisoners were only met with the prison guards returning with their limp, unconscious body and the return of the stale atmosphere prison life entailed. After the latest failure to escape, involving something about a rocket powered toilet and explosion magic, Angel convinced herself that no one was going to be getting out of here any time soon and agreed to merely turn a blind eye to what she normally saw for both entertainment and analysis...

As of now, Angel merely lay on the dank cot in her cell, staring at the ceiling as the moonlight from the window across from her quarters bled into the chamber. It was midnight but, Angel's sense of time was all but broken thanks to her imprisonment and she had lost count of what day it was...or even what month it had become during the beginning weeks here. Angel's face contorted with irritation as her dainty hands rested on her middle, a hungered growl radiating in the vast emptiness of her stomach. Angel was usually a light eater...but, when one doesn't have a decent meal in...well, years, you tend become more than a little ravenous. Angel had lost weight due to her meager prison meals, the grey prison garb she wore having being full with her feminine curves during the start of her prison sentence. Now, it was beginning to loosen with each passing month, her body growing thinner and weaker to reflect an equally hopeless situation.

She never thought she'd feel this same hunger...this same feeling she had when she was trapped in the Tower of Heaven during her younger days...

But, this was where she would remain...

THUD

Or, so she thought...

Angel brought herself upright as she witnessed a passing guard pass out in front of her cell, an enigmatic purple mist sparkling in the moonlight and saturating the halls. The uncertainty of what this mist was made Angel scoot back on her cot, her mind characterizing the mist as one thing, "Poison...!?" Was she...was she on death row after all? Dammit, those bastards told her she only had 50 years not, execution!

"Blegh, sheesh, mighta used too much..."

Angel paused as the sound of a masculine voice echoed through the prison halls, the mist beginning to clear as it was blown away by a gentle breeze coming from down the hall. The source of this breeze made itself known as a average sized young man with short brown hair came into Angel's view, a paper fan in hand. The young man himself was fairly toned, not being without his fair share of muscle and fitness, this being held true by his exposed arms that jutted from a sleevless green tunic he wore. A pair of brown trousers covered his legs while those of boots did the same for his feet. Large armored gloves fitted around his fists, the fan gripped within his grasp looking comically small due to his large gloves. In a lot of aspects, Angel could liken the young man to a farmer of sorts, if only due to his wide-brimmed straw hat.

But even so...what's a 'farmer' doing breaking into a high security Mage prison in the middle of the night.

"Ahh, are you the girl they call...Angel?" The man questioned taking a moment to look her over and thumbing through the physical outlook of the one he wished to find. Sure enough, she fit the appearance in his memory perfectly...well, sorta; she was a bit fuller in figure from what people told him, now she just looked a bit too skinny. "You uh...you fit the description."

By this point, Angel saw no point in keeping silent on the questions buzzing underneath her silvery mop. "First off, who the hell are you?" She asked with an apprehensive but, rather cold glare. "Second, what do you even want from me?"

"Oh right, I should explain..." The straw hat man muttered, before he stepped back and reeled his fist back. "Well, the name's Marco Agaric and, to put it simply..." His arm mucles bulged as magical energy pulsed through his arm, a large mushroom manifesting in place of his glove as he threw it forward and knocked the sturdy prison bars clean off their hinges. Angel jumping in surprise from the clattering of the steel pitifully falling to the ground and looking up to the escape route this 'Marco' had created for her...

"...I'm bustin' you out."

This...this was a joke, right...?

Was this guy seriously breaking into this prison...to break HER out of it?

It sure seemed like it, but...

"No, you're joking," Angel shook her head in disbelief, the mage being her too long to believe that someone was actually helping her escape. She was supposed to die here...not be rescued by a random mushroom mage farmer guy. "Why me, why not anyone else?"

"Well, I don't really have time to explain in full but, let's just say you're destined for bigger, better things and I'm willin' to train ya..." Marco said, his large mutated arm morphing back to normal size and shape as he walked into the cell. The mushroom mage took a brown bag off from his back and rummaged within it, soon coming to produce something odd and propose something odder. "But first, eat this. You'll need it." The mushroom mage pulled out a glowing fruit from his leather bag. Angel's black eyes gazed at the pineapple shaped fruit, it's color being a bright yellow as a lime green energy glowed within it's core. The fruit was big enough to fit in the palm of her hand but when held by Marco, it looked positively microscopic.

Angel's stomach rumbled as she gazed at the luminous fruit, the hunger that gripped her giving all the reason to gobble up this strange fruit and not give two squats what happens after digestion. However, Angel wasn't about to rush into this, she knows of betrayal and was not about to suffer through any of it anytime soon. This was all...so sudden and random that she found it hard to follow through on. "Hmph, why should I trust you? How do I know you're not going to betray me later?"

This was getting a little old. "Look, I know this is all too good to be true, but we ain't got a lot of time." He looked back, the guard still asleep as he planned but, he knew the others would not stay like that for long. Time was running out and he needed to get Angel out of here before security tightened like a constricting python. "My Lazy Spore spell won't last more than 15-20 minutes tops and we're already on the clock. So...unless you want us both going back in the slammer, you'll eat this here fruit, clench your butt and get ready for one hell of an escape. I promise I'll spill the beans whenever we're as far away from this place as we can get."
1553321111.title: Fallen Angel

15533211111.content:
Beggers couldn't be choosers, and right now, Angel was being quite the chooser...

It wasn't like she didn't want to escape from this dreary prison, it was the fact that everything was going so fast and being conducted by someone she didn't really know. Sure he could be leading her on into a trap but, right now, this could be her one and only chance to break free of these chains and make a break for it. Angel weighed her options, and glanced down to the glowing fruit she (supposedly) had to devour. She...didn't know why she needed to eat this but, if it meant getting out of here, then she'd have to trust Marco on his word.

"I have my eye on you." Angel told the mushroom mage, quickly grabbing the glowing fruit in her hand and cramming it hungrily into her maw. She normally, would have taken bites out of the weird fruit, but her hunger drove her to ditch feminine manners and messily eat the magical fruit and gulp it down. Angel thumped her fist on her chest a bit, the fruit's half chewed and half whole form hitting snags on the way down, but her gesture managing to send it on it's way into her stomach. The taste of the fruit...was actually very good, being sweet and juicy without any seeds (oddly enough). Angel could feel a lot of aspects in her body strengthening by the second, mostly in her waning strength. Her stomach let out a growl of thanks, Angel blushing a bit from her stomach's outburst as it set to digest the fruit and process the nourishment it held.

Marco didn't seem to notice.

"Good, good. Now all we have to do is get outta here." Marco said, heading out of Angel's cell and checking the halls, everyone was still out cold which meant there was still time to get the funk out of dodge before the gassed beehive of prison guards woke up to sting their asses. "Annd we're still good on time. Let's scoot, I don't wanna be around when this place starts buzzin'."

"Can you remember your way back?" Angel inquired to Marco, as she followed the mushroom mage down the hall to, what she hoped, was her freedom. "Avernus Rock is built like a labyrinth...only the guards know how to move through the prison." A maze like design of the prison was a natural defense against escaping prisoners, and those who wished to infiltrate. Lost enemies were usually captured before they could even figure out which turn they had taken that caused them to get lost in the first place. Marco merely nodded, bringing his arm back and throwing his mushroom fist forward to bust through the first door, the escaping duo coming out in a massive hall of chains, halls and prison cells.

"Ohh..." Marco trailed off, Angel giving him a flat look.

"You don't remember, do you?"

"I-I do, I just need to figure out which way I took getting here." Marco said, completely disregarding the fact that it still showed that he didn't recall which way he took getting in. "Don't worry, I got this."

"I have a sinking feeling that you don't..."

Marco ignored Angel's lack of faith in him and continued to examine his surroundings, the ticking of the clock seeming to do him no justice in coming up with any sort of correct answer. "Bah, screw this." Marco said with a click of his teeth as his fist slammed onto the ground. "Summoning Magic: Agaricus Muttshroom!" Marco declared, a dark green magic circle manifesting beneath both him and Angel, the silver haired mage looking down in confusion. The glowing runes soon gave rise to a giant, quadrapedal creature, the body being similar to a dog but the head looking more like a lizard with a giant mushroom spurting from it's head.

"Yeah, trying to navigate this place is bunk, let's just bust through all the walls." Marco said, climbing up onto the giant mushroom that grew from the beasts head, Angel would have done the same but...she a bit taken a back to really move from her seat on the creature's back.

"What, but won't everyone wake up from the noise?"

"Not really, Lazy Spore functions by time limit, so we can make as much noise as we want!" And with that, the mushroom monster let out a roar and bolted forward, lunging at the nearest wall and using it's hulking size to break the stone walls of the prison and appearing on another path, this one seeming to be on an incline that lead upward and around to a higher level.

"Ah, this way!" Angel called out, pointing up the incline. "We're in S-Block which means we need to go higher!" Avernus Rock was divided up by 'blocks' each one being relevant to the accused mage's crimes. In Angel's case, her being associated with one of the most powerful dark guilds netted her a nice, cozy cell in S-Block; a place where the worst criminals go and was also the furtherst from the entrance to the prison.

"On it! Let's go, Muttshroom!" Marco shouted, his fungal summon turning around and running forth up the incline and began it's destructive rampage through the once peaceful prison. Angel held on as tight as she could manage, the fungal beast doing it's absolute beast to tear it's way through S-Block and make it to the entrance no matter the cost. Angel had no sense of how long the 'escape' took but, her mind could only guess that Marco and Muttshroom was at this for awhile. However, a quick glance at a passing wall showed Angel that they were actually making progress as her eyes laid witness the word "B-Block". As much as she doubted Marco to actually produce results in their escape attempt...he was actually making decent progress despite the less than precise manner he was handling things.

"Are we getting close? I can't really tell!" Marco asked to Angel, seeming to think that she knew at least something of the prison's layout given her hint from earlier on.

"Just a little farther, we need to get past A-Block and we're home free!" However, something in Angel's gut told her that it wasn't going to be that easy. Angel may not have had much sense of time, but she knew that a lot of it had passed since Marco's break in and supposed usage of Lazy Spore.

"Now all we have to do is make it outta here and we're home free."

"That's far enough!" Came a cold, womanly voice from below, Angel knowing just who this voice belonged to...

"It's her..." Angel muttered, gritting her teeth as she realized by just hearing this voice their chances for escape, let alone survival, were severely reduced...

"Her? Her who?"

"Warden Satanaya..."

Marco blinked and looked down to see a tall, domineering woman down below, sporting militaristic look and feel to her. Long, icy blue hair cascaded down from underneath a military cap, her complexion fair and flawless. A pair of crimson eyes burned from behind the oval shaped glasses she doned as light pink lipstick glazed across her full lips. She was a curvaceous woman, having a large bosom and full hips that filled the nooks and reaches of her fitting military uniform. A flowing red cape hung down from behind, further proving her status as this prison's top dog and ruler.

"Clever trick using some form of sleeping magic to put my guards to sleep, I can say that's perhaps the only factor in why you managed to get this far." Satanaya remarked, unsheathing her rapier and thrusting it to the two defiant mages (plus one fungal monster). "But rest assured this is as far as you two will ever get. You should be familiar with Avernus Rock's slogan...once you enter, you may never leave." A chilling wind howled through the cavernous halls of A-Block, Satanaya's red gaze glowering of a paradoxical mix of an icy fire that burned of vengeance...a vengeance for Marco and Angel causing such a ruckus in her prison. She was going to make them pay the ultimate price for disturbing her hive of faithful drones and flawless reputation.

Angel didn't like the look of this. Freedom maybe within their grasp but she already knew they were stuck just by the warden being here. If they chose to fight, Satanaya would merely drag on the fight until everyone awoke and then things would really get bad. "Marco, we have to run!"
15533211111.title: Escape from Avernus Rock

choices: No, there's no way she could...
155332111111.content:
As much as Marco felt like he should run...he knew for sure that Satanaya wasn't going to allow them to escape. Something about the ice queen of a warden told of a tactical and reserved woman that knew exactly of how he was going to work. That said, Marco needed to do the unthinkable...and that meant fighting Warden Satanaya! "Muttshroom, get Angel out of the way!" Marco barked, throwing himself off the fungal monster who barked his own acknowledgement as it's summoner hurtled down to the warden awaiting below.

[ BGM Load ~ http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3rediAz1y... ]

"That's not going to save you!" Satanaya declared, raising her sword on high. A magic circle expanding beneath her as the an icy magic swelled through her form. The warden was on the attack. "Ice-Make - Nifelhiem Sabre!"

Marco threw his gaze upward as he saw a magical gate manifest from above several large swords made up of ice appearing in it's area and ready to drop at any given second. He landed with a thud and rolled, dashing to Satanaya with his fists transforming for his assault. "Muttshroom!" Marco barked, the beast of living fungus leaping out of the attacks vicinity just in time for the icy swords to fall onto it's position.

"Matango Knuckle!" Marco threw his fist forth, his arm swelling many times it's normal size into that of a gigantic fist with mushrooms sprouting from it's muscular length. Naturally, Satanaya set to deal with this by defending focusing on the incoming fist and not moving a single muscle...

"Ice Make - Riot Shield!" A rectangular construct jutted out in between Satanaya and the mushroom mage, the shield buckling slightly underneath Marco's might but holding fast and doing it's job despite the cracks at the center of impact. "Just by fighting me, you've signed your admission to this prison." Satanaya coldly declared, thrusting her rapier forward and shoving the shield forward.

"You'll have to take me in kicking and screaming, girly!" Marco pushed back, attempting to stop it's advance. It didn't work.

"The only one to scream is you..." Satanaya muttered, eyes narrowed, as she coldly uttered her next words. "Ice Make - Iron Maiden..."

Marco paused, looking behind him to see the enormous visage of an iron maiden standing a ways behind him, the chilling construction wafting of mist as it creaked open to reveal a death sentence of thousands upon thousands of icicles just waiting to impale him the moment the shield shoved him inside. Marco's eyes went wide as he finally realized how much danger he was in and how little time there was to react. "Ah shit!" He stammered, throwing himself to the side of the shield's advance and caught his footing to rush back toward Satanaya.

The icy warden was already gearing up for Marco's brazen charge, quite literally even. "Ice-Make - Gatling Cocytus." At her command, a pair of immense gatling guns materialized at Satanaya's side, the warden thrusting her rapier to the advancing Marco. The icy firearms complied in kind by whirring to life, their barrels spinning faster and faster before a volley of icicles fired forth bombarding Marco's rush forward. The mushroom mage ducked and dodged as best he could, his attention barely able to catch Satanaya as she charged, rapier at the ready to strike him while he was occupied with not getting shot.

"Ooh dip! Mole Truffle!!" Marco dove forward arms, transforming into mutated mushroom claws as he disappeared into the floor of the battlefield, sending out a thick plume of noxious spores in his wake. Satanaya halted in her charge and covered her nose and mouth with her cape, eyes beginning to itch and water from the spore's presence slowly enveloping her.

"D-Damn, he went below ground..." Satanaya cursed, canceling the fire of her Cocytus Gatling to further tune herself into her surroundings for any sudden movements. The prison fell silent, Satanaya's red eyes doing their best to make any sudden motions as her ears picked up the slack to hear anything out of the ordinary. Soon enough, the sound of the floor giving way alerted Satanaya to her left side, the warden turning to see a familiar figure jumping out of the stone floor. "Found you!" Satanaya rushed forward and jammed her rapier right into the forehead of the concealed Marco, the dangerously pointed blade making a distinct piercing sound as it impaled the head of her opponent.

Or so she thought.

Satanaya's eyes widened with shock as she saw the visage of what she truly stabbed, a mushroom shaped like Marco that had been erected from the ground to throw her off. "Wh-what!?" The warden stuttered, her sense of focus thrown off for only a second before she looked to her side and in a split second heard the floor give way right beside her. Impulse took over as she tried to cast another Ice-Make to defend--

WHAM!

But it was too late...

"Matango Knuckle!"

The intense force of Marco's enlarged mushroom knuckle slammed into Satanaya's side, as it's bulky mass shot out from the ground just beside Satanaya. Marco shoved his fist forward and sent Satanaya went spiraling off toward Muttshroom of Angel's position, Marco popping his upper body out of the hole and perking up at the opening of a finisher for this entire thing. "Muttshroom!"

Muttshroom barked out, raising it's paw and catching Satanaya in mid air and knocking her to the floor, the collision resounding with an earthly boom. The once powerful warden of Avernus Rock now lay in a self made crater, down...but not out.

"N-not bad...but that's nothing compared to what I have in store for you..." She said forcing herself up, trembling a little from the aches in her body but, not about to let those slow her down in the mission to apprehend these two. "Let me show you just why they appointed me as Warden of Avernus Rock..."

"Oh damn...she's still got reserve powers!?" Marco stepped back, now beginning to realize he...probably should have taken Angel's advice and run for it when he had the chance. "Damn, I think I might fucked this one up...bad."

Angel, while feeling just as cornered as Marco, had another sensation to deal with; a persistent hunger.

A gurgle bubbled from the, supposedly, empty recesses of Angel's gut, the pangs of an untamed hunger twisting in her like a vice. She had thought that fruit would have tied her over until she got out...it seems that the odd fruit wasn't enough after all. She needed something more...filling, something bigger, meatier...

It HAD to be meat...but, where was she...?

Warden Satanaya

...
155332111111.title: Decisive Battle ~ Ice vs. Shroom

choices: They're not out of the woods yet, those guards are hot on their trail!
Fast Forward a few days, Marco and Angel managed to ellude being captured.
1553321111111.content:
Angel's black eyes craned down to the still downed warden, her magical power swelling by second. She...was wide open now, but wouldn't remain as such for long. Could Angel...really eat her? Well, the answer to this question would have to rely on actions alone as the hunger within her took over and Angel dove off Muttshrooms back like a divng falcon onto a rabbit. A dull thud rang out from where Angel tackled the warden, the taller women squirming underneath Angel uncomfortably due to her still pained body.

"Get off me this instant!" The warden demanded.

"Food does not talk." Angel seethed out, her eyes hazed with intense hunger and her face shaded with darkness. In no time to spare, the prisoner's maw gapped wide to recieve Satanaya's face and clamped down on her head slurping her up and back into her gullet as her hand guided the rest of her down her yawning throat. Muffled screams and protests rang out from the grotesquely large bulge that was slowly sliding down deeper into Angel's eager gut, the prisoner tilting her head up as Satanaya's large bosom slipped into her mouth and sent the rest of her torso down to join the rest of the hapless warden in Angel's steadily expanding middle.

Marco emerged from the hole and looked up to the curious spectacle, thunderous gulps and swallows echoing back to his position and beckoning him forward to lay witness to Angel...actually eating his opponent. "...Uhm." Was all he could say as more and more of Satanaya disappeared behind Angel's lips and deposited itself into the growing pale dome that wriggled and squirmed from underneath her worn out prison blouse. The clatter of metal resounded through the prison as Angel wrenched the rapier loose from Satanaya's hands and tossed it elsewhere, not about to have her belly sliced open by such a pointy object.

Things were reaching the final stretch as only the kicking legs of Satanaya remained outside, Angel pressing onto the struggling warden's large, shapely backside to push her down her throat and with another damning swallow, the stocking clad legs and black high heeled boots disappeared from all outside view and slid down Angel's throat joining the rest of Satanaya's thrashing body in Angel's extremely swollen gut. Angel had very little to say on her actions and merely tried to process this overstuffed sensation, her ebbing midsection far bigger than she would have imagined thanks to her meal's taller stature.

"Oh gods...umf...too much..." Angel was still a novice at...whatever it is she just did and while, she felt like she would wretch Satanaya back up, her stomach clenched all openings and exits as it tried to digest it's immense and thrashing workload. Angel winced as a deep booming rattled within her belly, a flickering of cyan blue light giving hints as to what was going on in her labored gut. Groans rose from both Angel and her stomach as Satanaya tried time after time with her Ice-Make spells to get out...but with litle results save for causing Angel's belly to swell out with each failed attempt.

"Wow, your gut's pretty tough..." Marco noted, Angel shooting him an evil glare.

"Will you...quit marveling and help me?" Angel burped, her stomach gurgling around it's tough meal as digestion tried to begin as a means of silencing this active morsel. "Ugh...really wish she would just *urp* settle down already."

"We'll just have to let nature take it's course for this one." Marco noted, hoisting Angel up and trying his best to both hold her up and remain standing from how hard Satanaya was struggling inside her. Muttshroom lowered his head down as as Marco helped the bloated Angel up and came to set her down on the beast's back. They were only half way out but, things were only just beginning for the poor stuffed Angel. Marco perked up as he heard the clamoring of the slowly awakening prison staff, his heart skipping several beats as he slapped Muttshroom's back. "Let's move, Muttshroom. Times up!"

And with that, the mushroom beast burst through the wall of A-Block and through the main gate, it's large form running across the stone pier and disappearing into the forests just seconds before the sirens blared from the revelation that there had been a break in...and one of it's prisoners was missing...
1553321111111.title: Absence of Justice

choices: They find the beautiful spring and settle down for the night.
15533211111111.content:
Angel groaned in pain as the mushroom beast galloped into the forest, the movement of the creature making her distended gut bounce up and down again and again, and it didn’t help that her meal was STILL alive, only fighting harder and she could hear her yelling and curses. It just made her stretched out stomach ache more and more.

“You okay back there?” asked Marco as he controlled the beast as it weaved it’s way past the trees. Angel could only groan and grunt as she tried to massage her engorged stomach.

“Just…what the…hell,” she panted. She gave an “umf” and seethed when Muttshroom bounced over a rock. Her hands went to her stomach as she closed her eyes in pain.

“The hell what?” Responded the Mushroom mage.

“Did you…feed me!” She glared. Marco opened his mouth to answer, but the two of them heard wailing alarms in the distance.

“Great, here come their airships,” growled Marco. Up head, the two saw a cave to the left. He turned his head, his face meeting Angels, who nodded in turn despite the endured expression.

“Giyup!” He commanded, and Muttshroom bounded to the cave and went in further and further until…

“Okay that’s far enough,” said Marco as the mushroom dog-lizard stopped and lowered it’s head to help it’s occupants to the ground. Marco lept off first and offered his arms to the white haired girl, who was struggling to get off.

“Any time now,” muttered Marco, Angel threw him a look. And finally she slided off the beast…

And crashed onto Marco, her giant three-foot distended medicine ball belly smothering him. Angel winced and seethed with pain.

“God daaammnit…” She moaned. Marco rolled out under her and offered his hands to help her up. She took them and wobbled up to her feet.

“Muttshroom, close the door,” commanded the man.

“Wait hold on-“ Angel was interrupted as the beast began to claw away at the cave walls, making rocks crumble down more and more. Angel looked on in horror.

“What are you…you doing!” Yelled Angel in shock. Before long, through all the dust and debris, the cave’s opening, which was about fifty yards away, was now caved in ten yards away from them.

“Making a hide out. Before I infiltrated the Rock, I scoped out this place as a possible hide out incase we needed to camp out somewhere,” said the mage.

Angel still gave the man a glare but sighed. “Then how are we gonna get oxygen or water or-“

“There’s a fresh water spring further in the cave and there’s a small outlet near by it for air. Told ya, I scoped it out.” Angel’s mouth shut at Marco’s response and gave a deep sigh.

“Alright then fine. Let’s hide out there for a few days and we’ll see what we’ll do next,” said the white haired woman. Marco nodded.

“Sounds good to me,” replied the mushroom mage. With a simple snap, Muttshroom was dispelled, and he helped the gravid large-belly woman through the cave with a glow in the dark mushroom.

“I’ll admit this much, you’re magic is weird,” said Angel.

“Eh, it’s Earthland. There’s supposed to an evil gang specializing in farts, if it’s any consolation my magic is self-sustaining. I mean, I can make food and what not.” Angel irked at Marco’s suggestion. She’d rather avoid eating another of those mushrooms.

She wouldn’t want to become like that predator that consumed Satanaya at Avernus Rock. Sure, it got rid of her nemesis and she gained some odd ability that proved useful, but it was so…wrong and odd she couldn’t explain it.

Her eyes turned towards her partner-in-crime. Just what is Macro Agaric? Why would he risk himself to bust her out of Avernus Rock prison, so close to Era the Fiore’s magical capital? There’s no way he’d do it out of charity, and she didn’t date when in Oracion Seis, simply due to putting on the appearance of both power and her status was above the likes of Dark Guild buffoons.

Which means he’s working for someone…but why her? Why not Midnight, with his magic cancelling abilities? Or Racer with his extreme speed? Or even Cobra, being a Dragon Slayer and what not?

She narrowed her eyes at the back of the man’s head as she waddled further into the cave.

‘I’m onto you Agaric, and you better not screw me over or you might end up like the good warden...’
15533211111111.title: They're not out of the woods yet, those gua...

155332111111111.content:
Freedom was something Angel was always willing to embrace, after her sentence in Avernus Rock she was more than happy to finally spread her wings and taste the air that, for once, was not stagnate and rife with the stench of prison. However, what only seemed to put a cramp in this, otherwise, pleasurable situation was both the one who freed her and the motives in which he had done so. To Angel's current knowledge, nothing the mushroom mage did seemed to make sense and when compared to the fact that there other choices far more suited to being released than her...well, it only made her even more skeptical of just who Marco Agaric was. Thankfully, he agreed to tell Angel all she would know soon enough.

"Can you walk okay?" Marco asked, glancing back to see that Angel was making due with waddling but, looked as though she was having a lot of difficulties with just that alone. "The good Warden seems to have calmed down quite a bit now."

"That doesn't make her any less heavy. Oof, feels like I've been knocked up or something..." Angel huffed in exasperation, her dainty hands cupping underneath her huge belly as she hoisted it upward. The swollen gut had pushed the shirt of her prison uniform up, giving partial exposure to the glorious rounded dome of her taut, pink belly that lay beneath. Angel didn't even bother thinking of the inevitable weight gain from such a hefty meal.

"I can summon Muttshroom again to help out." Marco offered, walking back to Angel's side. "We're gonna be walking for a while anyway..."

"That's another thing," Angel began, eyes narrowed with suspicion as she glared to Marco with her inquisition. She was intent on stripping as much information out of the mushroom mage as she possibly could, indigestion be damned. "Where exactly are we going? You still need to tell me what exactly -urp- it is that you're after."

Marco, much to her surprise, didn't seem entirely dodgy or unwilling to cooperate, the mage nodding to her as he adjusted his straw hat. "Sure thing, I did promise ya that, after all." His eyes pan over to the cavernous path ahead, the way looking to take quite a while to reach the very end...or at least, a point where they could safely rest with little worry of being gibbed by a search party. "'Sides, we're gonna be walking for a while, it'd be good to have some convo going."

Angel said little, but merely nodded as she waddled along side him, her overblown gut emanating of an oncoming digestion that was going to prolong well into the daytime hours. "Alright from the top, what are you after, Marco Agaric? I could give you my thanks for freeing me from the Rock but, surely you're aware of the other members of my guild?"

For once, Marco hesitated, the mage rubbing the back of his head as he let out a nervous chuckle or two. Angel's eyes squinted with skeptism as she lay ready to catch any form of lie or fabrication from the strange mage. "Well, yeah...I did know about your other guild buddies but, me busting you out was more of a personal choice, really." Marco answered, with a small blush. Angel rolled her eyes at the thought of Marco having freed her if only due to a grade school crush. "As for my motives, well...that has more to do with my guild than anything else."

Ahh, so he was working for someone else then. The only question was...who were they?

"A guild, huh? Looks like I was right in assuming you worked for someone else. Well...who are they?"

"Viper's Eden." Marco answered with folded arms, "My mission, or at least, the mission of a lot of folks in the guild, is to find folks and recruit them into our ranks. Pretty simple stuff."

"Okay then, what of that fruit you fed me." Angel was especially eager to find out about the nature of this new trait she's acquired, most importantly if that fruit had done anything else to her in the process. Angel is well aware of there being especially nasty variants of fruits that can cause horrific and grotesque bodily mutations and, naturally, she feared that she was going to end up like one of the many unfortunate victims to mutagenic fruits.

"That was the Fruit of Life, Viper's Eden members are kinda required to keep at least one on them when heading out." Marco replied, "The Guildmaster told us that the Fruit of Life helps in facilitating the evolution of magical power. So, by giving folks these fruits, it will help to further enhance their abilities in magic. It's actually pretty neat since we're giving people lots of different magical abilities to use."

Angel pondered on his words for a moment, her mind attempting to dissect what Marco told of her. Since she consumed the fruit, that meant that she had some form of enhanced magic besides that of her normal magic that consisted of her summoning Celestial Spirits. The idea of having more power to command did intrigue Angel but, the anonymity of said new abilities proved a hurdle yet crossed. "So...that means, I have some new kind of power now?" Angel echoed her thoughts, eyes drifting down to the rumbling protrusion jutting from her midsection, the cream colored and taut dome trying to churn the warden away at a gradual pace. "...my power isn't eating people, is it?" Angel inquired, subconsciously rubbing the swollen dome of her gurgling gut.

"Actually, that's...kind of an enigma." Marco said, rubbing his chin as he inspected Angel's bloated gut. The angelic mage caught his gaze drifting up from her middle to ample bosom, something she reciprocated with a cold glare of death to which Marco relented at the sight of. "The type of magic someone gets when they eat the Fruit of Life is usually Caster type Magic. I mean...I got Mushroom Magic when I ate one and I didn't even have magical powers back then."

Angel froze, her belly sloshing and jiggling about as she abruptly halted in her tracks. "You...ate the Fruit of Life?"

"Oh uh...yeah, a long time ago when I was a kid. The Guildmaster gave me the fruit back when I was an orphan on the streets..." Marco recalled, his memory of his origins still fresh and vivid to him despite how long ago it was since then. "Back then, I didn't think the fruit was anything special since, to me, it was actually something to eat. I didn't know I had magic until years later, after that I joined the Viper's Eden guild since...I owed the Guildmaster for saving me. If he hadn't of given me that fruit, I wouldn't be walking through this cave with you right now."

Angel didn't expect to hear about his past so soon, but it at least gave her an idea of what he was like back in those days. Even so, the mention of the Guildmaster only seemed to quip Angel's interest in who it is that's behind Viper Eden and what their motives were. "You mentioned the Guildmaster before...know anything about him...or her?" As strange as it was, Angel has yet to meet too many guild leaders that were actually female.

"I...dunno much about him." Marco answered with a shake of his head, "When I joined Viper's Eden it was like no one knew who he was or where he operated. I only recall two others in the guild who knew of the leader and they...didn't wanna talk much about'em."

The journey through the earthen tunnel soon came to an end as the duo were led to an inviting spring located underground, a stream of cool, freshwater ran through the antechamber, and emptied into the mouth of an even deeper cavern off to the east side of the room. The chamber in which the freshwater flowed through was fairly small, albeit the ceiling of the earthly room towered above the duo for quite a ways. A hole from above provided a small amount of illumination via moonlight and would be their source of oxygen as they laid low here until they moved on.

"Ahh, here we are." Marco said, walking into the chamber and giving it a look around. "We can keep things on the down low here, after some time passes we'll get your to Viper's Eden HQ so you can join us."

"Hold on, I didn't say I wanted to join!" Angel declared, waddling into the chamber as her hands cradled her immense belly to prevent it from jostling and swaying about too much. "What makes you think I want anything to do with your Viper's Eden."

"Well, it's either that or get caught and thrown back into the Rock." Marco shrugged as he took a seat on a large stone by the stream. "Trust me, Angel, you're not the first bad guy to join our guild...there were others who came in and reformed under us. I mean...I dunno what you're all about but, I doubt you'd wanna go back to rot in the Rock."

It was true...she didn't want to go back there but, still...

"Still, it's not like I won't be unknown once I join another legal guild." Angel argued, waddling to the west wall as she slowly lowered herself down to finally rest her burdened legs and feet. Once her bottom finally touched the ground, it was then that she was able to feel just how heavy her middle truly was. The loud and churning dome still very gravid with Satanaya's remains.

"I can't say I know how he does it, but the Guildmaster has like these connections that pardons all previous crimes. It's like...starting over." Angel ran those words through her head, the bubbling of her gut working in tandem with her mind as she soon realized, this was a golden opportunity to finally be free. "Listen, I'm not forcing you to join us, I'm just giving you an option that could make things easier for you. With us, you can drop your fear of getting caught and live life as a free Mage again...what do ya say?"
155332111111111.title: Inquisition of Marco Agaric

choices: The next morning, Angel and Marco move out, the former fatter.
Can even villains dream? What is Angel dreaming of?
1553321111111111.content:
Angel gave it some thought, closing her eyes and leaning against the wall, hand on her giant gut. Marco, sitting across from her, had his hands behind his bed as he leaned back against a rock.

"Well?" He asked. The white haired woman opened her eyes, narrow as they were.

"I'll consider joining AFTER I've seen this Guild for myself."

"So, wanna dip into the water to see how the temp's like? Suit yourself then." He then Requiped a blanket into existence and walked over to the prone girl and placed it over her stomach.

"I never asked for one," she said with an inquistive glance.

"I know. If I used the blanket for myself then you'd whine that you'd want one." Now Angel didn't look as amused or nonchalant as the mushroom mage.

"Excuse me..."

"Look, all of your body's energy is going into digesting the warden right? So all of the heat will be centered there and not anywhere else," He walked back over to his boulder and Requiped a smaller blanket into existence. Angel closed her eyes and slighly nodded, taking in the mushroom mage's advice. He had a good point. It wouldn't do right for her if she just died of hypothermia right after getting out of the prison.

"I am gonna be a bit cold so you will owe me for this," remarked Marco. Angel scoffed and rolled her eyes, leaning back and rubbing her gut underneath her blanket.

"Whatever." She looked up at the small opening in the cave's ceiling, seeing some birds fly about in the night sky thanks to them crossing over the moon, and the white haired girl couldn't help but feel envious.

As far as she remembered, she was nothing but a slave at Heaven's Tower. She escaped, but then resigned to serving Brain of Oracion Seis and rose to become one of the most powerful Dark Guilds in Fiore, but even then she was forced to obey Brain, essentially becoming a servant AGAIN. Then she is defeated by that damned blonde girl and that Blue Pegasus pretty boy through the ultimate Celestial Spirit spell, and wound up in the Rock even as she tried to escape the Woodsea, the Rune Knights found her and her guild mates. It didn't help that the no good traitor Hoteye, or Richard as he likes to be called now, sold her out and detailed every single god damned crime she did under Oracion Seis' service.

It's like a twisted joke. She, as one as beautiful as she, as one who has had a terrible childhood growing up, she has been forced to always serve another at some point in her life. And now that cycle continues. She has broken free, and now going to resign herself to some Dark Guild.

Would others know of her reputation? The beautiful but fearsome Angel, the Celestial Spirit Mage? Would she be given a rank? She knows how to lead lesser ranked Dark Guilds and inspire the fear of god into them...

But then again, she has no spirits. Her Golden Keys were taken by that damned blonde Fairy Tail mage and her other spirits taken when she was arrested and given away to other mages elsewhere. She knew because one of the guards told her so in person, then spat in her face.

Maybe she could rise up and this Guild's master? Maybe she could convince this Marco fellow to follow her? But what would he want in return? Not to mention he owes his life for the Master saving her. Maybe she can find others? But Marco already told her that there were others like herself that were indebted to the Master for "redeeming" them,

She gave slight scoff, and groaned as her belly gurgled. "Ah shut up and become body fat already." She cursed, flicking her stomach. She leaned her head back and closed her eyes. Nothing but the drip-drops of the cave, Marco's breathing, and the occaisional sound of a fly-by Prison aircraft lulling her to sleep.

15533211111111111.content:
As time marched on through the night, the unlikely duo of Angel and Marco slept through the relentless quest of the Avernus Rock guards to find and retrieve their escaped convict. From high to low, it didn't appear that the search team were going to turn up any form of results at all tonight but...this meant little in proving that they were going to give up. Oh no, twas only the beginning of a long and laborious attempt to locate and apprehend both Angel AND her fungal accomplice. That aside, the tenacious group were not intent on giving up after a night of set backs. Orders were issued to several teams to set up camp in and around the forest and continue searching tomorrow morning. If anything, the search from tonight would only be the beginning of Marco and Angel's difficulties in escaping their relentless mage hunt...

Morning came as gently as night had left, the rising sun bathing the forests adjacent to the Avernus Rock prison gradually receiving a shower of sunlight as the grass and leaves practically sparkled with the soft morning dew. All was silent here now, only the chattering song of the melodious birds could contest against the still atmosphere of the thick woodland area. That is...until an earthly crack tore into the silence, the sound of rocks rolling over and opening up . A clawed hand thrust from the face of a ledge as it tore through the earth surrounding it and allowed it's brother to help in creating an opening in the earthen matter. As the dust rose and cleared off, the figure of Marco walked out from the man made exit as he peered around the surrounding area, checking for anyone suspicious.

"Looks like we're in the clear for now..." Marco observed with a nod of his head, his hand adjusting his straw hat as he prepared to escort Angel to both her salvation and his own. "If we can make it to Viper Eden HQ, then we'll be home free."

"Ugh...dammit." Came the frustrated voice of Angel as she waddled and squeezed her way through the opening of the tunnel that led outside, the reasons for her awkward motions being evident in her...expanded figure that was all thanks to the one huge morsel her gut had processed and digested. Just as Angel told it to, her stomach had converted every inch of Satanaya's body into belly fat...but not just belly fat clung to her physique. "Couldn't you have made the tunnel a bit less cramped?"

The full visage of Angel did wonders in showing how much weight she had packed on; her middle was soft and swollen with excess fat, the jiggling dome swelling noticably from her normally somewhat loose prison shirt. Lower was a set of hips and thighs that flared and billowed outward, the thickset lower section of Angel's body filled out her worn out pants rather nicely, the rounded rump at her behind had also gorging upon the extra fat and gaining quite a bit of heft in each fattened and jiggly cheek. The mage's breasts remained largely unchanged but, did seem to bump up a size bigger or two as they rested comfortably atop her squishy paunch.

"I can't make it but so big, Angel." Marco shrugged, "Any bigger and the tunnel woulda caved in."

Angel only narrowed her eyes, finding nothing but bullshit in Marco's answer to her and even a hint of him poking fun at her new size. Even so, she let it go and merely sighed with exasperation and glared down to her noticeable paunch that bulged from her middle. "When I said turn her into belly-fat...I was kidding..." Angel muttered, pinching her flabby sides before placing her mind on other matters; like getting out of this forest without getting caught. "I have a good feeling that there are still guards patrolling the forests around here. It's not like them to give up after a single not of set backs."

"Yeah, I know. We're going to hafta move fast if we don't wanna get caught but...if we do, I have my Mushroom Magic to bail us out." Marco replied taking another look around as he and Angel stepped forward and began their cautious trek through the wilderness. For a time, Angel walked (which was slowly turning into a waddle) in silence as she kept watch for anyone looking to ambush them as they traveled. However, it wasn't until she realized something that she spoke up to break the silence...

"Do you know where you're going this time?" Angel inquired, giving Marco a skeptical look as she began to doubt the fungal mage's ability to navigate.

"Don't worry, I got directions covered." Marco answered in confidence, his eyes fixating on an especially large and colorful mushroom that grew from under neath a tree. "I planted mushrooms on my way through the forest, since I knew I wouldn't be able to navigate these woods." The mushroom mage approached his creation, kneeling down to call Angel's attention to the pattern on it's cap, several large spots looking to be like arrows that pointed northward. "So long as we follow my chain of shrooms, we'll be led right to Viper Eden Headquarters."

"Well, so long as you know where you're going." Angel nodded, willing to trust Marco with directions for once as she continued to follow her only lead to Viper's Eden HQ. The two, while seeming to not exactly see eye to eye, did have small conversations, albeit through whispers so is not to draw too much attention to themselves. However, as Marco located another two more of his marking mushrooms, something didn't...sit right with Angel, it was a dreadful feeling that tied directly into her paranoia and one that had the (now tubby) mage on edge and looking over her shoulder every so often. Naturally, Marco managed to pick up on this...

"S'the matter? Someone behind us...?" Marco asked in a whispered voice as she slowed his advance, looking back to look for anything out of the ordinary...

155332111111111112.content:
And before the duo's eyes was a large, and very visibly angry animal os some kind. It looked to be the size of a small horse, or a very large dog, but it looked hostile and aggressive nonetheless. It was lizard like in appearance, with a Monitor's head hissing and making an open growl as it's maw was open, venomous bacteria leaking from it's mouth. It's legs were those of a lion's, sharp claws pawing at the dirty. And it's tail was that of a scorpion, swishing side to side and it's stinger erect.

"Great, a Monitorplion Chimera. Just what we need right now," growled Marco in frustration and duo taking a step back. Everyone has heard of the Monitorplion being especially venmous and aggressive, and were solitary creatures who created their own territories. Angel turned her head, with a gaze as venomous as the monster before them.

"You planted a trail through this guy's turf?" She snarled.

"Hey I didn't know excuse me!"

Angel instinctively reached for her side where her keys would be, but found nothing. She cursed to herself slightly as the chimera stalked closer and closer.

"Shroom Bomb!" Called out Marco, throwing a mushroom at the creature, whose tail struck out like lightning, batting the small truffle to a tree and making it detonate. As Marco and Angel backed away slowly and slowly, Marco tried to through more bombs, only for the beast to swat them away with it's tail.

"Summon your muttshroom thing!"

"I need time, and that's a luxury we can't have right now!" Barked back Marco. The chimera was slowly approaching, drooling at the thought of ravaging the intruders.

Then a pang hit Angel in the stomach, a similar to the one before she ate Satanaya. Normally she would try to resist the urge, but they were out of options...

"Fuck it," She mumbled, causing Marco to turn towards her with a raised eye.

"Huh?"

And right was the chimera leapt, mouth wide and claws extended, so did Angel, her mouth opened wide and chomped down on the beast. The beath fell into her mouth, head and paw first, and Angels hands went up to stop the tail from striking at her, grabbing it by the head, it's stinger near her nose. The beast struggled violently, but Angel hung on, legs steady as the Monitorplion tried to escape. Yet her mouth hung firm, trying to slurp in the beast inside to her throat.

"Whoa," was all Marco could say with raised eyebrows as Angel sat down, and slurped up the front legs of the beast and onto the midsection, a noticeable bulge in her throat. He rubbed the back of his head.

"I'm...gonna use the bathroom. You take care of business," he said, wanting to get away from the noise Angel was making. The white haired girl narrowed her eyes at the man, but resumed to consuming the beast, which has slowly stopped struggling, it's head down in her stomach. With a heave, she raised her head and the beast became upright upside down, and Angel slurped and gurgled as her mouth, her already soft gut becoming swollen and taut again.

And with a final gulp, she swallowed the Monitorplion Chimera whole, along with it's tail. And she gave a loud belch and coughed a little.

"Could have used salt..." She commented. When she tried to stand, she noticed she had difficulty, and she saw the reason. Her gut was now much larger than yesterday, and she could tell it was heavier than she was prior(she guess to be around 170 pounds), easily the size of a medium sized bean bag chair. And now she was helpless trying to get up.

She gave out a large sigh of frustration. "Marco!"

15533221221122211.content:
Lucy walked into her apartment and closed the door with a sigh. She stretched and collapsed onto her bed.

"Welcome back Princess," Vigor announced.

"Vigor? What are you doing here?" Lucy asked sitting up on the bed.

"I sensed that you were stressed and frustrated. Is there anything I can do for you?" Vigor offered.

"What are you talking about? I feel fine," Lucy defended.

"Are you sure?" Vigor asked as she popped behind Lucy. Vigor began to rub her shoulders. "I could give you a massage," she offered. "Or I can make you a home cooked dinner," she said knocking around in the kitchen. "Or maybe you would like to take a warm bath?" she said starting the bath.

"Virgo stop, I'm fine," Lucy called. She started to stand up but was forced down back down by Virgo.

"Please Princess, let me help you," Virgo begged. Lucy looked up at her spirit. Virgo's hands were placed firmly on Lucy's shoulders, her arms fully extended. She stared into the spirit's blue eyes. Her jaw slacked slightly. "Perhaps you simply need a hug," Virgo concluded and brought Lucy into her bosom. Lucy blushed and froze as Virgo's warm cleavage brushed her face. "Is that better Princess?" She asked. Lucy was confused.Why was she acting like this? Why couldn't she move? Suddenly Virgo released her and went into the bathroom. "Your bath is ready Princess," Virgo informed. Lucy was still stuck on her bed. "Princess?"

"Coming Virgo," Lucy spoke. She stood up and walked into the bathroom. As she undressed she couldn't stop thinking about the hug. Virgo was so warm and caring. Without being asked she came into her world and tried to help Lucy feel better when she herself didn't realize she was upset. She got into the bath and lost herself in thought. She only left her realm of contemplation when the water grew cold. She got out off the tub and dried herself off. She then wrapped a towel around her abdomen and left the bathroom. When she entered her room she saw that Virgo was gone. With a relieved sigh Lucy dropped her towel and went to grab some clothes. As she walked something caught her peripheral. She turned her head and saw Virgo leaning over to get something out of the oven. Thanks to her short skirt Lucy could see the spirit's panties. A shiver went through her and she felt a tingle in her genitals. Virgo stood up and turned.

"Hello Princess. Did you enjoy your bath?" she asked. For a moment Lucy was once again frozen before she screamed and ran to her towel. She quickly grabbed it and covered herself, her entire face red. "Do you need my help getting dressed?" she asked.

"No, no, no, no, no! I can dress myself!" Lucy stammered. She threw on clothes and took a moment to calm down. She took a deep breath and then walked over to the table where Virgo was waiting. "What are you doing?"

"I'm finishing your dinner Princess," Virgo explained.

"But I didn't..."

"You need to eat Princess and you seem to be distracted so I made you dinner. Please," Virgo said gesturing to the chair. Lucy sat down and Virgo brought out the food. The dish was Asian Salmon Sliders with Citrus Yogurt Sauce. Lucy took a bite and was surprised at how good it was. And, was also surprised that Virgo was able to incorporate her favorite food into the dinner. As she ate she got a bit of yogurt on the corner of her mouth. Virgo picked up a towel and dabbed it on her tongue before wiping Lucy's mouth.

"Uh, thanks..." Lucy said and continued to eat. After she was finished Virgo took the dishes and and brought in dessert. It was a slice of ice cream cake. Lucy took the plate and began to eat. Once again the food was fantastic.

"I made a whole cake which is in your freezer. You may finish it whenever you like," Virgo informed.

"Thank you Virgo," Lucy said. After she finished Virgo once again took the dishes.

"Is there anything else you need Princess?" She asked. Lucy thought about this for a moment.

"Yes...
15533221221122211.title: Story line 1

155332212211222111.content:
Lucy was strolling along the canal on her way home. She was staring at the ground truly confused. This weird tingling in her stomach whenever she thought about her spirit was really bothering her. She could feel the jingling of her keys as she walked. She could almost feel that same warmth radiating from Virgo's key that she felt last night from that hug. Virgo had agreed to come by again tonight and Lucy didn't know what to do. As she approached her apartment she stopped short at her door. She took a deep breath before opening the door to find Virgo standing there waiting for her.

"Welcome home Princess," she greeted "your bath is ready for you."

"Oh, thank you," Lucy said putting her bag down. Lucy entered the bathroom and noticed a change of clothes already waiting for her. Lucy undressed and stepped into the tub. She used the warm water to relax and calm her nerves. You're okay Lucy. You're fine. There's nothing strange about you wanting Virgo to be here. She's a helpful spirit. She's a maid after all. There's nothing odd going on with you. She thought as she bathed. After drying off and changing clothes Lucy emerged to find dinner on the table. "What is this?" Lucy asked sitting down.

"Fillet of Beef Bourguignon," Virgo explained. Lucy ate dinner and then Virgo brought her a slice of cake before doing the dishes. Afterward Lucy went to bed. This happened everyday for for the next week. Lucy would come home with a warm bath waiting for her and then Virgo would be standing there with a new and delicious dinner on the plate. That is until Sunday. Lucy got home and placed her stuff down and sat on her bed. She sat on her bed and seemed almost to wait for Virgo to show up even when she knew she wasn't going to. As she waited a pit formed in her stomach. The longer she waited the larger the pit grew.

"WHAT IS WRONG WITH ME!?!?" Lucy screamed. She fell back and hit her head on her window. After dealing with the pain from her head the pit didn't go away. Why do I miss her? She's my friend sure but I see her all the time. She's been here everyday the passed week why does it feeling like I need her here? she wondered as she hugged her pillow.

The next day Lucy went about her business in the guild hall and then came home to see Virgo standing in her living room. "You're here," Lucy said a little shocked.

"Yes Princess. I assumed you would want me here. If I'm not needed I can go," Virgo offered.

"No. I'm glad you're here," Lucy said "is..."

"Your bath is ready," Virgo interrupted. After her bath she walked into the living room and saw Virgo standing next to her dinner. Lucy sat down and started to eat. "Would you like any pepper?" Virgo asked. Lucy nodded and Virgo bent over to get the pepper grinder over the food. When she did that Lucy got a clear view of her chest. Was it bigger? "Let me know when Princess," Virgo informed. Lucy stared at her spirit's chest. She could have sworn that her breast were bigger. They had to have increased by a cup size. Maybe two. "Princess?" Virgo said to get her master's attention.

"What?" Lucy shivered.

"Is that enough pepper for you?" Virgo asked. Lucy looked down and saw her dish covered with pepper.

"Yes. Thank you Virgo," Lucy smiled. She took a bite of her food before grimacing at the favor. She pushed through every bite and then guzzled down her drink. "Can you refill this?" Lucy coughed.

"Of course." Virgo took the glass and walked away. Lucy couldn't help but look at Virgo's ass as she walked away. Virgo had obtained a slight sway as she walked. Yup, her ass was bigger too. After dessert Virgo left and Lucy went to sleep or she tried to. She couldn't stop thinking about Virgo.
155332212211222111.title: "Can you come by again tomorrow night?"

1553322122112221111.content:
What was happening to Lucy? Her every waking moment was spent thinking about Virgo. Not even her dreams were safe from the spirit. Virgo was serving her food like she had every night, except Sundays, for the past two weeks. Lucy was eating a 20oz steak with a large helping of fries. Lucy devoured it, every bite dripping with ranch. After she finished Virgo took the plate and put down a whole 5 layer lasagna.

"Eat up Princess," Virgo said. Lucy without argument began eating. After that Virgo brought out a Shepard's pie. And that's how it went for the next hour. Lucy would eat bigger and bigger meals as Virgo would clean the table and make more and more food. After her 7th meal Lucy pulled back and rubbed her belly. It was the size of a basketball. "Are you ready for dessert Princess?" Virgo asked. She placed a whole trifle on her plate. Lucy took a spoon and started eating. Lucy ate until she reached the bottom layer of the trifle. She scooped some fruit but when she did she saw skin. She looked at the plate the trifle was on to discover that it wasn't a plate. It was Virgo. "More dessert?" she asked. Virgo's DD cup breast were covered in whip cream and she was wearing edible underwear that clung to her thick thighs. Lucy licked the rest of the trifle off of Virgo's belly before Virgo sat up on the table. Virgo put her hands on Lucy's distended belly and rubbed it. "Are you full now Princess?" Virgo asked. She slowly leaned forward. "You have something on the corner of your mouth. Let me get it for you," Virgo said before planting her lips on Lucy's.

Lucy woke up with a smile. She then frowned as she realized it was a dream. She touched her lips as she realized what had been happening. She had fallen for Virgo. Her stomach rumbled and interrupted her train of thought. When she looked down she was introduced to another realization. She had gotten bigger. Her belly, that used to be flat, now stuck out two inches. She touched it to confirm it was real. She pulled up her shirt and jiggled her tummy. Lucy didn't mind it. She actually enjoyed it a little.

155332221111.content:
The sea, the sun, the surf, the seagulls, the skies. This is what Kelp Town is like...

Well, during the summer that is.

It is January for the far northwestern Fiore coastal town, and the clouds have blocked out the sun, the seagulls are annoying as ever, the water is freezing, the sea kelp forests block out most of the harbor.

With a slash from her sheathed sword, more kelp leaves became undone, drifting away on the waves. A woman took a deep breath on the boat's ridge.

For Kagura Mikazuchi, this was a simple and repetitive job to clear kelp trees to allow boats in and out o the harbor. The town mayor would offer to their local guild: Mermaid Heel, the famous all-girls Guild of Fiore, this job usually once a month. And one can tell that Kagura is the standard bearer of the Guild.

Of reasonable height, she stood on the small dingy’s ledge, her sheathed sword: Nemesis, in hand. Her hair was in a traditional “princess-cut”, long and dark-brown to the center of her back and bound by a ribbon. She possessed a figure many a female would dream for and many a male would drool over, as confined within her elaborate blazer was a toned yet full figured physique, her breasts full and above average. She also donned a shirt and tied underneath the blazer, and underneath her mini-skirt were black leg tights and thigh-high boots. With the cold stinging in the air, the extra clothing proved to be a fond choice in keeping the girl warm. She face was set in stone, a permanent scowl locked onto her beautiful visage.

“Whoa-whoa! Kya!” Stammered a girl in another boot not to far from her. Kagura turned her head giving the source of the voice a look from her deep chocolate eyes.

“Watch your balance Beth. These Kelp won’t clear themselves should you fall in, not to mention the water’s freezing,” said Kagura sternly.

“Yeah…just slipped a little and landed on my butt. Sorry about that Kagura-chan,” replied Beth Vanderwood.

Compared to Kagura who was a stone faced beauty of a swordswoman, Beth was a cute farmgirl. She was shorter than Kagura, about a good half-a-head and had deep orange hair done in two braided pig-tails behind her head and had wide blue eyes. She had a child-like face to her, her nose smaller perhaps not even visible when looking at her face to face. Were not for her rather wide hips and thighs underneath her overalls people could have mistaken her for a young teenager, perhaps even a pre-teen.

“You shouldn’t have worn sandals. You could have taken into account that the boat may be slippery,” remarked the swordswoman as she made another cut, cutting more of the kelp underwater by sheer air pressure alone from her sheathed sword. Behind her, she heard more of Beth’s Carrot Missile being fired, spearing through the top parts of the kelp trees.

“Okay okay I won’t wear sandals again,” said the farm girl.

“At least you have learned a lesson and walked away from this with a positive experience.” The two continued their job cutting down the kelp trees

“Mou~,” complained Beth. “Why couldn’t Millianna-chan come out with us? She’s back at the harbor probably dozing off again.” She gave a cute pout face puffing her lips out.

“Millianna detests cold water you know that Beth,” said Kagura as she made another slash. More chopped up kelp.

“Yeah but still, she’s not getting a single Jewel for lounging around right?”

“Of course not.” Beth shrugged.

“Works for me. I need to save up for more gardening tools.” She fired more missiles into the water and Kagura nodded, resuming her task until…
155332221111.title: A Day in Kelp Town

choices: "I don't really remember anything other than my name."
"I'm still shook up over drowning. I'm not confused."
1553322211111.content:
Kagura sliced away another fair section of kelp from the water, the cut leavings floating along the water in the mild current of the water. She raised her scabbard, about to attack another area of the encroaching plant. She hesitated for a moment though when she saw something was amiss in the murky water. A pale body stuck out like a sore thumb among the green and blue around it. The figure had layers of kelp all around it, including some that covered its face. The skin on the body was incredibly pale, but there was a subtle lift in the chest every few seconds that showed the person in the water was alive. "Beth," Kagura said plainly. "Stop what you're doing."

"Huh, what's wrong?" Beth asked, blinking a few times as she waited for a response. Either way, she stopped firing her Carrot Missiles and came over to where Kagura was standing.

"Let me see one of the oars," Kagura asked, before Beth handed her one of the wooden implements. "There's a body over here," she noted in case Beth hadn't seen. The swordswoman began to use the oar to pull the figure towards the boat, dragging it through cut kelp on the way.

"Oh gosh," Beth said sadly. "Is she alright?" she asked, looking at the body. The short dress that seemed to be her only article of clothing was the main hint to Beth that the body was female. When the girl was next to the boat, Kagura calmly placed the oar down and picked it up with little difficulty. The girl was unconscious, and incredibly small. Shorter than even Beth was, she was quite skinny and flat as a rail.

"It would appear so. We should help return her to the town in case she needs medical attention. Can you please wake her up?" Kagura asked. Beth nodded, but first she wanted to clean the girl up. She was covered in kelp, so Beth started pulling it off of her. It was messy work, but the farmgirl was used to dirty conditions. There was a thick glob of kelp on the girl's head, covering most of her face. Beth grabbed a good handful and picked it up.

"Ow!" Beth dropped the kelp, and looked around. Not seeing Kagura in any pain, she tried to pick up the kelp again. "Owowowow!" Beth stopped, and moved the kelp to the side to see the girl's face. "Please stop pulling on my hair..." she said.

"Your hair?" Beth said, confused. She grabbed one piece and tugged lightly, making the girl's head bounce up slightly. "Oh, my. I'm really darn sorry, I thought it was kelp, I didn't realize it was your hair," she said sheepishly.

"It's okay..." the girl said, before coughing. She let out a few deep coughs, having to sit up in order to get the worst of it out. There ended up being a small puddle of water on the bottom of the boat from what she'd coughed up. "Ack, ptooie, what, where am I?"

"You're on the outskirts of Kelp Town," Kagura answered her, continuing to lead the boat to the dock. "My name is Kagura, my companion is Beth."

"Uh, what, what happened to me?" she asked, letting out one more cough as Beth helped her up.

"Well, hun, we were hoping you'd be able to tell us that. We found you laying in the water covered in kelp. You alright?" Beth asked, lifting up one of the girl's arms so she could see if the girl was injured. "Naw, you seem like you're not hurt at all."

"I think I'm alright, but I don't really remember what happened to me," she said.

"Well, what's your name?" Beth asked.

"Um, I think it's Pelk..." she said, sounding unsure.

"Why do you sound confused?" Kagura asked, sternly.

"Well..."

The green haired girl, whose eyes were covered by her kelp-like hair, sat on the boat, fiddling with her fingers. "Well...I don't really remember anything other than my name..." She looked to the side, ashamed. "I'm sorry..."

"It's alright. There is no need to blame yourself," reassured Kagura. "I'm sure you'll regain your memory. It will just take some time." She turned her head to Beth.

"Take us back to Kelp Town. We'll talk Pelk to the Guild Hall."

"Got it!" Said the farm girl as she strapped an SE-Plug and started up the boat's engine, steering the rudder towards the harbor.

Pelk sat on the boat, hands clenched to the bench under her for support as the boat sped along the water. A bump in the waves made her lose her grip, falling forward onto Kagura. "Kyah!"

The swordswoman managed to maintain her composure, stopping them from falling, although...

"Pelk, are you alright?" Asked the brunette as the seaweed-haired girl recovered, looking up...Her face was nestled right inbetween her bosom, Kagura's eyes blinking and neutral. The girl jumped and went back to her spot on the boat, pale cheeks pink.

"S-Sorry...I-I'm fine...and I'm sorry for-"

"Don't worry about it," said Kagura shrugging. "I managed to cushion your fall with my breasts, so I don't see the the problem."

"Well...you see..."

"Alright, we're here!" Beamed Beth as she slowed the boat to a stop at the docks. The farmgirl hopped out and tied the boat with rope connecting it to the metal peg. Kagura stepped out and offered her hand to Pelk, who took it and was pulled up easily onto the docks.

"My goodness," Beth said looking over the girl up and down. "We gotta get you some clothes and shoes!"

"Let's take her back to the guild, we can find some spares for Pelk to wear. You must simply be freezing," said the Kagura, hands crossed over her chest.

"I-I'm fine...really you don't-" Pelk didn't have a chance to object as she was taken hand in hand by both Beth and Kagura and they began walking down the wooden docks.

It was quite dangerous, you could have drowned if we hadn't come across you," Kagura asked, keeping a firm, protective grasp on the young girl's hand as she walked to their guild hall. Pelk shook her head, looking up between both of the other girls, holding their hands.

"Sorry, like I said. I've just got 'Pelk' and that's it," she said.

"Do you even remember if you lived around here?" Kagura said. "I don't recall seeing you around, though I'm often on missions." Pelk shook her head.

"Hm, maybe it'd help if'n we figured out some other facts about ya first, like what food ya like," Beth offered, scratching her neck as she looked around, smiling at some of the local shopkeeps.

"Um, seaweed maybe?" Pelk said meekly, like she was unsure. She got an odd stare from the other two girls.

"We can discuss it later. For now let's get you cleaned up and dressed. Mermaid Heel isn't one to let a fellow female go without aid, especially when we live so close by," Kagura said matter-of-factly.

"Oh, well thank you again. That's very kind of you, but I was trying to say earlier that I-" Pelk was interrupted as Kagura opened the door to the Guild Hall. She was met by the joyous yet subdued welcome from the other members of the guild. Beth smiled widely in particular, her grin a bit goofy but cute on her freckled face. Kagura enjoyed the welcome as well. It wasn't as raucous as she heard Fairy Tail was, but her guild was full of kind, strong people she was proud to call her companions.

"Welcome to Mermaid Heel," Kagura said to Pelk, letting go of her hand. Beth stayed held on to the girl. "Alright, let's go see if we can find you some nice clothes to wear, we've got a shower you can use, and then I'll go find you some clothes."

"I'll put up a notice that we've found you, in case anybody recognizes you they can contact us to come pick you up," Kagura said, leaving Pelk with the farmgirl.

"Alright, let's head to the shower, I'll get ya cleaned up," Beth said, dragging the girl along while Kagura explained the situation to the others.

There was silence before the group as they sat at their table. Kagura had her arms crossed over her chest, eyes closed. Millianna was looking at herself in a hand-mirror she Requiped, and Beth was busy sipping milk. Leaving Pelk to fiddle with the helm of his dress.

"So..." He said, hoping to start a conversation. "Why were you guys out there?"

"Out where?" Asked the cat fangirl looking at the femme.

"Ummm, out at sea. Where the Kelp Forest was, where you found me."

"We were clearing excess kelp that was rising to the surface in great amounts," Kagura replied, making the table's occupants turn towards her. "The town got it's namesake for the plant, but I never known it would grow this much so fast."

"Maybe it's the work of magic?" Millianna pondered, finger to her lips.

"Anythin's possible!" Beth added. "Mah guess is that the reason on what could be causin' the plants to grow s'much maybe at the bottom of the seaweed forest!"

"We may need to dive in then." The swordswoman remarked, turning her sharp eyes towards her companions.

Millianna shook her head. "I can't imagine what's down there! And my magic wouldn't work underwater either!"

"Same for me too Kagura, sorry." Beth rubbed the back of her head. "Mah veggies wouldn't move as fast underwater." Kagura nodded then turned towards the femme.

"Then you'll join me yes?" She asked, her attention on Pelk.

"Huh?" His attention was turned towards her. "Who me?"

"Yes." Kagura said, her gaze intense. "You wouldn't mind would you?" She said, though judging by the tone of voice she won't accept no for an answer...

Pelk laughed nervously. "N-No not at all...maybe I can find more of my memory if I join you. I was found out there with amnesia right?"

"Then it's settled. We will go first thing tomorrow morning." Kagura sipped from her drink. Meanwhile, Millianna scooted closer to Pelk.

"So, diving with Kagura. I bet you seem stoked on that huh~?" She asked with a mischievous cat-like grin on her face.

"Stoked on what?" Pelk asked nervously.

"Oh nothing, that Kagura might ski-NYYY!" She cried and she fell face first onto the table. "Nyooooowwww~"

Kagura's sword was missing, but Pelk had a good idea where it was. "Good thing that was sheathed..." He commented, he felt Kagura's gaze upon him and he stiffened up, and returned to sipping his drink as Beth tried to get the wind back into her feline-fanatic friend.

15533222222222111.content:
It was a fine day in Fairy Tail's Guild Hall. Bodies, barrels, chars, and tables were flying, drinks and food were being consumed, and Happy was once gain trying to get Carla to take a fish. This time, though, he had commited a neccessary evil: He cooked it.

"PLEEEEAASSSSE?"

"No, Happy."

"PLEASEPLEASEPLEASEPLEASEPLEASE?"

"NO, Happy."

"Pretty please with anchovies and caviar on top?"

"FINE! I'll take the fish." Carla yanked the grilled salmon from his paws, and took a bite so the blue Exceed would shut-

Oh. It was delicious. Had she really been missing out on this all this time? Carla didn't even notice that she had eaten the rest of the fish, until she let out a quiet belch. Her face flushed red. So uncouth, both stuffing her face and belching! In public no less.

"Did you like it?" Happy was still there, eyes sparkling, waiting for an answer.

Carla couldn't just out and say yes, but still... it was DELICIOUS.
